loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 40 years old, married and has two children. She has been operating a salon business for ten years. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to expand her business, thus improving her standard of living. Susan hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future. She has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to buy hair braids.

loans.use: To buy hair braids

loans.name: Nestor Raul

texts.es:
El cliente es un joven Doctor, es Odontologo de la ciudad de Pilar, hace un año que esta ejerciendo su profesión, es soltero, sin hijos, vive en casa de sus padres donde también tiene su consultorio totalmente equipado.
Su papá es Abogado y su mamá Docente, es el menor de cinco hermanos. Todos los demás hermanos ya no viven con sus padres ya que todos han formado sus respectivas familias y todos son profesionales independientes. El se considera una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, a quien le gusta trabajar. Desea seguir creciendo como profesional para una mejor atención a sus clientes.
Él solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos a utilizar en su consultorio, con lo que podrá atender a sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le da.
texts.en:
This client is a young doctor, he is a dentist in the city of Pilar.  He has been working in his profession for the last year.  He is single and without children, and lives in his parents home where he also has his fully equipped consulting office.

His dad is a lawyer and his mom is a teacher; he is the youngest of five siblings.  All the other siblings no longer live with his parents, as they have all formed their own families, and are all independent professionals.

He considers himself to be a very hard-working and enterprising person, who enjoys working.  He wants to continue to grow as a professional, so as to provide better service for his patients.

He is requesting the loan to buy supplies to use in his consulting office, with which he will be able to tend to his patients.  He is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity they are giving him.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his dental consulting office.

loans.name: Makauzviitire Group

texts.en:
This is 27 year old Patience (raisng her hand) from Masvingo, a town in south-eastern Zimbabwe. She is married with two children, one attending school.  Patience runs a flea market business selling clothes and footwear. The business has been in operation for 2 years. She says the main challenges faced are lack of working capital. 

Patience has requested a loan of $300 to buy blouses, tracksuits and sandals. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the family's general welfare. In the future Patience plans to operate a retail outlet.

loans.use: to buy clothes and sandals for resale

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan is 57 years old and she lives alone in Dusheti, in the Mtskheta-Mtianeti region. She is busy with her handicraft business and she designs and sews various traditional Georgian clothes. Ketevan also purchases handmade traditional Georgian clothes and accessories from other designers and sells them locally. Her total monthly profit from selling clothes and handicrafts is 400 GEL.
	
Ketevan is requesting a loan to purchase traditional Georgian handmade clothes and accessories to sell. She will also use part of her loan to purchase materials to sew Georgian clothes. In the future, Ketevan plans to arrange an exhibition of Georgian clothes and accessories in Dusheti. She thinks that it will be especially interesting for the tourists visiting their region.

loans.use: to purchase traditonal Georgian clothes and materials to sell

loans.name: Progress Two Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 28 year old Wanisai (raising her hand) from Masvingo. She is single with one child aged four. Wanisai runs a retail business selling clothes and footwear. The business has been in operation for 11 years. She says the main challenges faced are debtors failing to pay on time. 

Wanisai has requested a loan of $300 to buy more clothes and footwear accessories. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the family's general welfare. In the future Wanisai plans to open a number of shops.

loans.use: to buy clothes and footwear accessories for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase clothing and young chicks to sell

loans.name: Christian

texts.fr:
Cliente de 35 ans,marie et père de 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 6 et 10 ans. N'ayant pas d'appui considérable pour la poursuite de ses études , il s'est lance depuis 2006  dans la restauration .

Soucieux de son ambition de devenir propriétaire d'un restaurant avec grille moderne , ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer le stock des bidons d'huile, sac haricot, carton de poisson sale , carton de poulet et des tas de maniocs. 
Pour atteindre son objectif  il envisage beaucoup epargner et avec ses obligations parentales, il cherche a subvenir a la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This 35 year old client is married with 2 children, ages 6 and 10. As he didn't have enough support for his studies, he became a caterer in 2006. His goal is to have his own restaurant with an up-to-date grill. This loan will allow him to increase his stock of barrels of cooking oil, bags of beans, boxes of salted fish, boxes of chickens and cassava.

In order to reach his goal, he plans to save a lot and, to meet his obligations as a parent, to pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy barrels of oil, beans, boxes of salted and smoked fish.

loans.name: Nhamoyapera Group

texts.en:
This is 41 year old Patricia (holding the folder) from Masvingo a town in south-eastern Zimbabwe. She is married with four children, all attending school. She also cares for four dependents. Patricia runs a food business selling vegetables and fruits. The business has been in operation for 1 year. She says the main challenges faced are low capital. 

Patricia has requested a loan of $300 to buy more produce for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general family welfare and educate all her children. In the future Patricia plans to operate several outlets.

loans.use: to buy more produce for resale

loans.name: United We Stand Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you the members of the “United We Stand” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request loans of 500,000 SLL for each member to invest in his/her individual business. 

Ashiatu is the leader of this group. She is 38 years old and married with three children. Her husband is a trader and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. Ashiatu sells shoes. She has been in this business for many years now. Ashiatu will use her portion of this group loan to buy dozens of pairs of shoes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Takeu

texts.en: Takeu is 29 years old and is married with two children. For the past five years, he has been a wheat farmer. He learned about KADET through an advertisement and is applying for his second loan with KADET. Takeu will use his loan to buy wheat seed to plant and chemicals for spraying. He plans to use the proceeds from his loan to reinvest into his farm.

loans.use: to buy wheat seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Ruvimbo Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 41 year old Rebecca (raising her hand) from Masvingo. She is married with five children, four attending school. Rebecca runs a tailoring business producing clothes. The business has been in operation for 13 years. She says the main challenge faced is low capital. 

Rebecca has requested a loan of $300 to buy cloth and sewing accessories. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the family's general welfare. In the future Rebecca plans to operate a retail outlet.

loans.use: to buy cloth and sewing accessories

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 63 years old and is the widowed father of two adult children. For the past six years, he has been a dairy farmer and he earns a monthly income of 12,000 KES which he uses to support his family.

Joseph is requesting his second loan from KADET to buy a plot of land and venture into mixed crop farming. He will use the anticipated profit from his loan to develop the new farm. In the future, Joseph hopes to export his farm produce.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land and venture into mixed crop farming

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
El Joven Alfredo tiene 33 años de edad, es propietario de un Taller Mecánico con Lavadero y gomería. Él es soltero, vive en casa propia, cuenta con la ayuda de su hermano que se encarga de administrar el Lavadero.
El se considera un hombre muy trabajador y luchador, día a día trabaja para poder tener un futuro mejor, ya que desea expandirse en el mercado. Uno de sus sueños es poder ampliarse y seguir creciendo. Comenta que ya tiene un buen tiempo en este trabajo, por lo que ya tiene una clientela bien definida.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de neumáticos y cámaras, con lo cual podrá cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Desde ya agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, ya que de obtener el crédito, este le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Alfredo, 33, owns a mechanic's workshop with a car wash and a tire shop.  He is single and lives in his own home.  His brother helps him with the business; he is in charge of the car wash.  

Alfredo is considered to be a very hardworking and tenacious fellow who works each day in order to have a better future, since he wants to expand in the market.  One of his dreams is to be able to continue to grow and expand his business.  He comments that he has already been doing this work for awhile, and so he already has an established customer base.

He requests a loan to buy tires and inner tubes so that he will be able to meet the demands of his customers.  He thanks the Fundación in advance for the opportunity they are giving him, since this loan will be a great help to him.

loans.use: to buy tires and inner tubes to later sell

loans.name: Mutetia

texts.en: Mutetia, a married father of  three children, has been a wheat farmer for the past three years. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD in order to buy farm inputs such as wheat seeds and to pay for land preparation. With the anticipated profits generated by the loan, Mutetia plans to pay school fees for his children. He dreams of becoming a prominent farmer and providing a good life for his family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as wheat seeds and to pay for land preparation.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: 37-year-old Richard lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of taking care of his wife and four children. He has operated a retail and electronics shop for the last 8 years and with the proceeds he has been able to buy land and pay school fees for his children. He wants a loan to purchase electronics equipment to sell.

loans.use: Purchase electronics equipment to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for transport business.

loans.name: Adolphe

texts.fr:
Client âgé de 51 ans, marié et Père de quatre (4) enfants dont l’âge varie entre 3 ans et 11ans.
Par manque d’appui pour la poursuite de ses études supérieures, il a crée une micro-entreprise dont la vocation est la restauration, spécifiquement la vente des repas froids et des sandwichs.
Ses revenus sont de 25000 frs a 50.000frs par jour
Au regard de la fréquence des clients et la rareté des produits  et certaine qualités de saucisson, le microcrédit permettra d’appuyer l’activité pour assurer sa croissance et la réalisation de sa vision qui n’est autre avoir un service traiteur moderne. Faisant face aux obligations liées à son statut, il est exemplaire dans sa communauté.
texts.en:
Our client is 41 years old, married, and the father of four children, from 3 to 11 years old. Due to a lack of support for pursuing higher education, he created a micro-enterprise with the main focus being in the restaurant business, specifically selling cold meals and sandwiches. His revenues range from 25,000 to 50,000 francs per day. 

With regard to his frequent customers and his shortage of goods, and of some aspects of his sausages, this micro-loan will enable him to support his business in order to ensure its growth and the realization of his vision, which is none other than having a modern catering service. Facing up to the obligations related to his position, he is a model for his community.

loans.use: to buy bread, dried sausages, boxes of cheese and ham, and boxes of pasteurized butter

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 71 years old, a widow with one adult child. She has been a dairy farmer for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 12,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. She will use the loan to buy a piece of land and venture into mixed crop farming. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will start pineapple farming. Her hopes are to own a big farm which will help her support her siblings.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land and venture into mixed crop farming.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 59 years old and  married to Ann. They are blessed with two children, aged twenty-five and twenty years. He has been in the farming business for the past three years with the monthly income of KES 11,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan to buy a piece of land to expand his farming. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children up to university level. His hopes are to develop his farming a lot which will help him improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land to expand farming.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 38 years old; married to Agnes. They are blessed with three children aged twelve, six and two years. He has been a mechanic for the past ten years with the monthly income of 30,000 Kes. which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his third loan from KADET. He will use the loan to buy vehicle spare parts which will boost his business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open other mechanical branches which will help him improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Grace Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 49 year old Faith (raising her hand) from Masvingo. She is married with five children, three attending school.  Faith runs a retail business selling clothes, blankets and food. The business has been in operation for 10 years. She says the main challenges faced are financial constraints. 

Faith has requested a loan of $400 to buy more clothes, blankets and food for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the wellbeing of her children and to pay school fees. In the future Faith plans to own a company and employ workers.

loans.use: to buy clothes, blankets and food for resale

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
This is Sarah, 33, a resident of Payatas,Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Elmer, a marketing employee, and is the mother of two children, both of whom stay at home. She, her husband and her children manage their household while operating the business. At this time, Sarah is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Sarah maintains a direct sales business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct selling brands such as Avon, Fullerlife, and others. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing in as their income. Sarah also operates a copier machine and sells some school supplies near the school. Her regular customers are students, neighbors and the local community. Sarah earns a minimum of 700 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, Sarah is requesting a PHP 29,000 loan to buy orders for her customers and additional stocks of school supplies. A portion of the loan will go towards the maintenance of her copier machine. Sarah expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Sarah fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pesticides and a knapsack for spraying them

loans.name: Mambo Kwisha Development Association Group

texts.en:
Some business people have been taking advantage of the skyrocketing food prices in Uganda and East Africa to get more from clients. Because food prices have of late been going up, some restaurant owners have also decided to hike the prices on their menus. Somebody not abreast with the current economic situation may think she or he is being ripped off. Some business people may be doing that, but not 44-year-old Betty, a happily married mother of 5, who has been in the restaurant business for the last 30 years. Betty has steered clear of exploiting her clientele though she has found it inevitable to hike her food prices, but by a lower percentage.

Betty also works in the city council, which means it's easier for her to use some of her savings to purchase foods for her restaurant in case of shortage. She generates a weekly income of 100,000 UGX and calculates she will be able to make more once she gets this Kiva loan. Betty was in a bar business prior to this. Her future plan is to expand her business into a full hotel.

This is the fifth time that Betty's group is receiving a loan from Pearl Micro-finance. Their repayment record has been good. Betty intends to use this Kiva loan to purchase more cutlery and plates for her business. She will use the rest of the proceeds to carry out renovations on her restaurant premises.

loans.use: to purchase more cutlery and plates and to renovate her restaurant

loans.name: Jardin Del Lago Group

texts.es:
Jardín del Lago nace gracias a que una de las miembros del comité contactó con una de las asesoras, la cual le comentó sobre el programa de mujeres emprendedoras. Las mismas quedaron fascinadas con la idea y decidieron formar su comité. Actualmente se encuentran en el segundo ciclo, con 16 integrantes, las cuales están trabajando dentro de un ambiente de respeto, solidaridad y coordinación.
La señora Fátima, tiene 3 hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles como harina, azúcar, fideos y demás, en su casa. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes, los cuales siempre compran de ella. Dice que día a día lucha por sus hijos, ya que ellos son su motivación y quienes la impulsan a seguir adelante. Desea que ellos se conviertan en grandes profesionales, para que el día de mañana sean personas de bien.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, fideos y demás para abastecerse, y de esa forma cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Ella está muy agradecida con la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
"Jardín del Lago" ("Garden of the Lake"), was born thanks to one of the committee members's contact with one of the advisers, who told her about the program for women entrepreneurs.  These women were fascinated by the idea, and decided to form their own committee.  They are currently on their second lending cycle, and have 16 members who work in an atmosphere of respect, unity and cooperation.

Señora Fatima has three children.  She works selling food products such as flour, sugar, noodles and other items, from her home.  She comments that she has many customers who always buy from her.  She says that she strives on a daily basis for the sake of her children, and that they are her motivation, and what inspires her to continue moving ahead.  She wants them to become professionals, so that in the future they will be good people.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of flour, sugar, noodles and other items to stock up, and in this way to be able to meet her customers' demand.

She is very grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity it is giving her.

loans.use: to buy noodles, flour, sugar and other items for subsequent sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy beans and groundnuts

loans.name: Tashinga 1 Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 42-year-old Clara from Masvingo. She is married with six children, all attending school. She also cares for three dependents. Clara runs a retail cross-border business selling clothes and footwear. The business has been in operation for eight years. She says the main challenge faced is lack of adequate working capital to sustain the business. Clara has requested a loan of $300 to buy more clothes to meet market demand. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to buy her family home. In the future, Clara plans to own a shop to operate from and a car for easy transport of goods.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bags and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred, 53 years old, is married to Margaret and they are blessed with seven children aged from 12 to 28 years old. Alfred buys and sells household goods. He has been in this business for twelve years, earning a monthly income of KES 11,000.

This is Alfred's third loan with KADET LTD. He has borrowed KES 45,000 to purchase household goods such as basins, buckets, brooms, cups, glasses, plastic chairs, etc. for resale. Alfred will use the anticipated profit to increase his stock. His dream is to own a plot of land and build residential houses.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of household goods

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian lives in Uganda. She is single and has 3 children, one of whom is in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her elderly father). Lillian lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

Lillian has operated a business selling used clothes for over 10 years, working 7 days each week. Lillian sells her products in a shop at the retail level. She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of used clothes. Lillian generates additional income through a bar and rental rooms. The main business challenges for Lillian include thieves and seasonality. Her goals and hopes for her business are to start importing clothes, to sell at wholesale only and to build more rental rooms.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en: Josephat is a 27-year-old married man with two children. He rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling shoes for four years, having acquired the initial capital from farming. His hardships are poor transport facilities and theft. His goals are to have a wholesale shop and to educate his children. Josephat needs this loan to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: To buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, none of whom are in school. Sarah also takes care of additional family members (a sister). Sarah lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

Sarah has operated a cosmetics shop business for 6 years, working 7 days each week. She sells her products at the market, at the retail level. Sarah has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids. Sarah's main business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and hopes for her business are to build rental rooms and own a wholesale shop only.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids

loans.name: Bedan

texts.en:
Bedan, 60 years old, has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last ten years. He normally plants carrots and potatoes and sells them at the local market.  

Bedan was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers. For this loan, his third, he has borrowed KES 25,000, which he will use to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is a twenty-seven year-old married woman with three children.  She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling shoes for nine years. She started with capital of 30,000 shillings, selling from a friend's stall, but now has her own shop with stock worth two million. Her challenge is high licensing fees.  Her vision is to open another boutique and to educate her children.  Aisha intends to use the loan to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: To buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo kuña guapa es un comité de 15 mujeres que son muy bien organizadas, unidas, trabajadoras y solidarias unas con otras. Estas señoras son de la ciudad de Villarrica, las cuales son vecinas y amigas de esa ciudad. Se reúnen mensualmente para brindarse apoyo y ayuda las unas a las otras en su esfuerzos de mejorar su situación económica.
La señora Luz es artesana, ella se dedica a esto desde hace mucho tiempo, ya que desde pequeña ha aprendido como hacerlas. Este ha sido su sustento durante toda su vida. Comenta que tiene una buena venta, en especial con los turistas, ya que ellos admiran mucho la artesanía Paraguaya. Uno de sus sueños es que sus artesanías se vean en el exterior, lo cual sería un paso muy importante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de los insumos necesarios para la realización de sus artesanías, como ser telas de ao po'i, hilos, bastidores y demás. Ella tiene muchas esperanzas en el crédito, ya que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa group is a communal bank of fifteen women who are very well organized, close-knit, hardworking and supportive of one another. These women are from the city of Villa Rica and are neighbors and friends from this city. They get together monthly to offer support and help one another in their efforts to improve their financial situation. 

Luz is a artisan who has been doing this for a long time, ever since she learned how to make crafts when she was little. This has been her livelihood for her entire life. She says her sales are good, especially among tourists, since they really admire Paraguayan craftsmanship. One of her dreams is that her crafts be seen abroad, which would be an important step. 

She asks for a loan in order to buy the necessary supplies to make her crafts, such as fabric for traditional needlework, thread, frames, and so on. She has high hopes for this loan since it will be a big help to her.

loans.use: to buy fabric for traditional needlework, thread, frames, and so on, for craft making.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is a 51 year-old widow with two school-aged children.  For the last eleven years, Beth has been practicing farming in Limuru town. 
She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. This is will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and till the land.

In the future, she hopes to practice large scale farming, which will increase her income.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy produce and onion plants.

loans.name: Hasifa

texts.en:
Hasifa  lives in  Uganda.  She is married and has 7 children, 5 of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). Hasifa has a business of selling used clothes.  She works 7 days out of every week.  Hasifa sells her products in a shop.  Hasifa has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO.  She will use it to buy bales of used clothes. She also generates additional income by sewing table cloths.

The main business challenges for Hasifa include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build rental rooms and also to sell at wholesale only. Hasifa lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan has been operating a restaurant for the last five years in Limuru town. She is 40 years old and married to John. Together they are blessed with two school-aged children.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be her third loan. She intends to use the loan to add stock of sugar, maize and wheat flour. 

In the future, she hopes to venture into agriculture.

loans.use: To add stock of sugar, maize and wheat flour.

loans.name: Juan Ovidio

texts.es:
José, siembra granos básicos, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 16, 6 y 2 años de edad, él aprendió la agricultura por herencia de su padre, comienza desde las 4:00am a 11:00am, actualmente está sembrando maíz, y para fortalecerlo necesita de insumos como abono y plaguicidas, que son muy necesarios, el primero para desarrollar la planta y el segundo para prevenirla de plagas.
El préstamo será una gran ayuda para José, pues a través de este comprara estos insumos, mejorando la productividad de sus cultivos, para la comercialización y alimentación de su familia.
Con estos buenos resultados tendrá una mayor seguridad para su grupo familiar, ya que con la venta obtendrá dinero en efectivo para cubrir otras necesidades.
texts.en:
Juan cultivates basic grains.  He lives with his wife and three children aged 16, 6, and 2.  His father taught him to farm, and he works from 4am until 11am.  He is currently cultivating corn, and to support this effort he needs supplies such as manure and pesticides.  He needs these supplies a lot, first to plant his crops and second, to prevent pests.  This loan will be a great help to Jose, because it will allow him to buy the supplies that he will use to improve his crops, so that he can sell them and feed his family.

With these good results he will have better security for his family members, since with the sale of his crops he will have the cash in hand to cover other necessities.

loans.use: to buy manure and pesticides for his corn crops

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise and stock her store.

loans.name: Erastus

texts.en:
Erastus is 27 years old and married to Millicent.  They have two children, aged one and three years.  Erastus owns a cereals shop.  He has been in business for a period of three years, earning a monthly income of KES.12,300.

He is borrowing KES 50,000 from KADET LTD.  This is his second loan.  He intends to purchase bags of dry maize, beans, peas, rice, millet and sorghum.  The profits will be used to expand the business.  

He wishes to own a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To purchase dry bags of maize, beans, peas, rice, millet and sorghum for resale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives in Uganda.  She is married and has five children, none of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sister). Josephine has a business selling used clothes.  She has been in this business for nine years, and she works seven days out of every week.

Josephine sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.  She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of used clothes. 

The main business challenges for Josephine include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build rental rooms and also to sell wholesale only.   

Josephine lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees  and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Aloysious

texts.en:
29-year-old Aloysious lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of taking care of his wife and two children. He is a maize miller and also trades in agricultural products. He has been in business for the last three years. He has a challenge of price fluctuations and his dream is to increase his stock. 

Aloysious needs the loan facility to purchase maize, beans and groundnuts for resale.

loans.use: to purchase maize, beans and groundnuts for resale.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en:
Emilio is 50 years old and married to Joan. They have been blessed with three children. For the last year he has been selling like radios, CD and DVD players, plugs, chargers for phones.
 
He was introduced to KADET by a KADET staff member. This is will be his first loan. He intends to use the loan amount to buy stock,like CD and DVD players, plugs, and chargers for phones.

In future, he aspires to grow his business, hence improve his living standards.

loans.use: To buy stock ,like  CD and DVD players, plugs,and  chargers for phones.

loans.name: Cleophas

texts.en:
Cleophas is 49 years old, married and with two children aged  8 and 19.  He runs a retail shop where he sells cereals so as to earn a living for his family.  He uses his bicycle whenever he goes to get his business stock.  

Cleophas joined a group in Faulu Kenya so that he would access financial resources easily.  He has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy cereals.

Cleophas hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: John Bosco

texts.en: John Bosco wants a loan to pay school fees for himself. He is a Ugandan  man aged 31 living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He operates a private primary school and has been in service for the last five years. He started by renting the school premises but now owns the structures where he operates and his dream is to have one of the best performing schools in the district and well built to a level of mixed day & boarding.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his diploma course.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es:
Erlinda, vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 26, 11 y 7 años de edad, ella junto a su esposo trabajan en la crianza de ganado, tienen 5 años en el negocio, este surgió por el apoyo de una organización que llego al lugar para apoyar a los agricultores y ganaderos, juntos se dedican al trabajo y prácticamente las labores son de todo el día.
Actualmente se encuentra su esposo sembrando maíz y frijol y ella solicita un préstamo para apoyarle con los insumos agrícolas, abono y herbicidas, con estos materiales tendrá un mejor desarrollo el cultivo.
La aspiración de ella es trabajar fuerte al lado de su esposo, para sacar a su familia adelante, en cuanto a los cuidados de alimentación, salud y educación.
texts.en:
Erlinda lives with her husband and her three children aged 26, 11 and 7.   She and her husband work together raising livestock, which they have been doing  for five years.  This work came about through the support of an organization that came to their area to support livestock and crop farmers.  They work together and the work takes them almost all day.

Her husband is currently growing corn and beans, and she is requesting a loan to support him with agricultural supplies, manure and herbicides.  These materials will provide better crop development.

Her goal is to work hard alongside her husband in order to move her family ahead in life with food, health and education.

loans.use: to buy manure and herbicides for growing corn and beans.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 35 years old and married to Charles. They are blessed with one child. For the last two years she has been operating an auto spare parts shop in Nairobi town. 

She was introduced to KADET by a KADET staff member. She has been loaned KES.60,000 which she intends to use to add stock of vehicle spare parts for sale.

In future, Mary aspires for her business to expand, grow and become financially stable.

loans.use: To add stock of vehicle spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Dalias Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “DALIAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Elvira. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de mandiles, artesanías, venta de comida

La señora Elvira,  indica que es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora en la zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costra y venta de mandiles, los que viene trabajando hace siete años.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital (compra de telas) que adquirirá de la Ceja  y posteriormente a la elaboración lo venderá en la feria 16 de Julio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la amistad, el apoyo y en salud nos reflexiona.
texts.en:
The Dalias Communal Bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Community Center.  It is comprised of six members, and it is led by its Board of Directors.   Elvira is the head of the Board.  The members of the communal bank carry out various business activities like selling aprons, handicrafts, and selling food.

Elvira points out that she is working with Pro Mujer for the first time.  She joined the institution by invitation from a loan officer in the area.  She currently has a business making and selling aprons.  She has been doing this for seven years.

The loan she is requesting is to increase her capital (to buy fabric) that she will get in La Ceja.  She will later make the aprons, and she will sell them at the 16 de Julio market.

This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family.  She lives in a common-law-marriage, and she has two children.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Bonny

texts.en:
Bonny is a 48-year-old married man with three children, living in  a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to educate his children up to university. He has been cutting and selling firewood to schools around the area and has done the business for twenty-two years now. His major challenge is always lack of manpower to cut down the trees and then chop them into pieces and his dream is buy a tree cutting machine.

Bonny needs the loan to buy trees to be chopped into firewood for selling.

loans.use: To buy  trees to be chopped into firewood for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a blow dryer and refurnish her rental business premises.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is a forty-six-year-old single mother of four children and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Ever since she separated from her husband, she has been looking after the family by herself. She has been selling clothes for twenty years starting with 500,000 shillings and now has 2,000,000 shillings as her working capital. Her hardship is high rent and her vision is to own a boutique plus educating her children.

Marjorie needs the loan facility to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make university payments.

loans.name: Alozio

texts.en:
Alozio is a fifty-five-year-old married man with six children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family is solely vested in him and his desire is to educate his children. He has been dealing in clothes for six years and he acquired capital to start his current business from farming. His hardship is ever-changing customer preferences and his vision is a big boutique plus a good residential house.

Alozio needs the loan facility to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 46 years old and married. She has four children.  

For 20 years, she has been practicing dairy farming to earn a living. She also depends on her husband, who is employed, for financial support. She has boosted her business through the financial support from Faulu Kenya.

Hellen hopes to farm in large-scale in the future. She has requested 100,000 KES to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has been operating his tailoring shop for the last 20 years in Emali town. He is 62 years old and married, and he has five children.

He was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. 

He has been loaned KES 50,000. He intends to use the loan to buy cloth materials and a sewing machine.

In the future, John hopes his business will prosper and grow, so as to uplift the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy cloth materials and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas has been in the taxi business for the last ten years. He is 40 years old and married to Jane. They have three children in school. 

He was introduced to KADET by a KADET client. This is will be his first loan. He intends to use the loan to add stock of shirts and trousers to his boutique, which he runs alongside his taxi business.

In the future, Thomas intends to expand his boutique business, which will help him get more additional income.

loans.use: To add stock of shirts and trousers to his boutique shop, which he runs alongside his taxi business.

loans.name: St Yowanina Group

texts.en:
Neverless is a 50-year-old single mother with four children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

She has been operating a retail shop for 16 years. She started her shop with capital of 100,000 UGX, and now she has 1,000,000 UGX as her working capital. 

Her hardship is debtors who take too long to pay. Her vision is to run a wholesale business and to educate her children.

Neverless needs the money to buy sugar, rice and soap for resale.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and soap to resell.

loans.name: Jose Naun

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 14 y 2 años de edad, es agricultor, lleva 15 años en esta actividad, lo aprendió de su padre, trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 3:00pm, hasta el momento no ha tenido dificultades.
Por el momento necesita un préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y herbicidas, para aplicarlos al cultivo, esto le ayudara mucho, pues fortalecerá la planta y con la posibilidad de obtener una buena cosecha.
Él quiere ver que sus hijos crezcan y se puedan defender ya sea con un oficio o estudio, para sobrevivir con sus propias vidas, cada día trabaja con el mejor anhelo, para llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and two children, aged 14 and 2.  He works in farming, which he has been doing for 15 years, and which learned from his father.  He works from 6 a.m. to 3 p.m. daily, and so far he hasn't faced any difficulties.

He needs a loan currently to buy fertilizers and herbicides to apply to the crops.  This will help him greatly, as it will strengthen the plants and provide the possibility for a good harvest.

He wants to see his sons grow up, and be able to keep themselves in an office or a studio and be self-sufficient.  He works every day with a strong desire to provide for his household.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides to apply to his crops.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 48 years old and is married to Kimai. For the past 11 years, she has been a farmer in Emali town. Magdalena was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a client. 

Magdalena is requesting a 40,000 KES loan through KADET to purchase seedlings and till her land. In the future, she hopes to begin dairy farming to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy seedlings to plant

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a businesswoman who earns a living by running a beauty salon. She has been in the business for nine years and employs two people.  Previously, Lilian sold vegetables. Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save her money and manage her business and therefore has been able to maintain her business for nine years. 

Lilian is requesting a 60,000 KES loan to buy a hair dryer for her salon. In the future, she hopes to open other salon outlets.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a una de las miembros quien se motivo en la idea de producir un bien para sus compañeras, dando la una visión de que a través del comité estarían alcanzando el progreso de cada una.
Encantadas aceptaron conformar el comité de mujeres emprendedoras nombrándolo Maria Auxiliadora, el cual está integrado por 12 miembros. Estas señoras son muy unidas y de esta forma trabajan en grupo, dentro de un ambiente de mutuo respeto y cooperación. Todas tienen la esperanza de seguir luchando por salir adelante, buscando el progreso de cada una de ellas y la de su comunidad.
La señora Blanca se dedica a las ventas desde hace muchos años, por medio de esto ella ha logrado salir adelante y obtener mayores ingresos para paliar los gastos de la casa. Ella vende todo tipo de artículos, como ser ropas, zapatos, sábanas, frazadas y demás. Tiene muchos clientes, los cuales siempre compran de ella. Uno de sus sueños es tener un local en su casa donde pueda ofrecer los productos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de frazadas, sabanas, ropas para la posterior venta. Ella está muy agradecida a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda.
texts.en:
This committee came together thanks to one of the members who was motivated by the idea of producing good for her fellow members which arose from a vision that through the committee they’d be attaining progress for each and every one of them.

They were thrilled to be part of the committee of enterprising women that they called “María Auxiliadora” and that has 12 members.  These ladies are quite united and work this way in the group within an environment of mutual respect and cooperation.  They all have the hope to continue striving to get ahead seeking progress for each of them and for their community.

Blanca has been in sales for many years.  Through this she’s managed to get ahead and obtain increased income to manage household expenses.  She sells all sorts of merchandise like clothes, shoes, sheets, blankets and others.  She has many customers who always buy from her.  One of her dreams is to have home-based locale from which to sell her items.

She asks for the loan to buy blankets, sheets and clothes to resell.  She is very grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity it’s provided her.

loans.use: to buy blankets, sheets, footwear, clothing and others.

loans.name: Ana Mirta

texts.es:
Ana integrante del Banco comunal “Adonay” perteneciente a la comuna de Cerro Navia, ciudad de Santiago. Se dedica al rubro de la amasandería desde hace 7 años. Ella prepara estos productos en su casa y los vende en el mismo lugar, sus clientes son conocidos. Los productos que prepara regularmente son empanadas de pino, marisco y queso fritas. Ella comienza a trabajar a partir de los días jueves hasta los días domingo. 
Su mercadería la compra preferentemente en ferias libres y supermercados. 
Con el crédito comprará insumos para su amasandería.
Ana sufrió una delicada enfermedad lo que obstaculizó su negocio hace un tiempo, sin embargo logró recuperarse y salir adelante por lo que ahora se dedica a disfrutar el presente sin proyectarse, por lo cual los ingresos que brinda su negocio son el sustento económico diario. 
Ella vive junto a su madre e hijo de 26 años, el se encuentra a la espera de un trabajo, por mientras le ayuda en su negocio. 
Uno de sus principales sueños es tener una buena salud, que le permita trabajar con tranquilidad. Además le gustaría viajar fuera de la ciudad de Santiago. 
Ana está muy contenta y agradecida de los créditos y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza, además comenta que la experiencia de trabajar con el grupo ha sido muy grata, ya que los demás socios son acogedores y comprometidos, por lo que no han tenido ningún inconveniente. 
Cerro Navia es una comuna de la región metropolitana (donde está Santiago, capital de Chile) ubicada en el sector poniente. Se caracteriza por ser una comuna con altos niveles de pobreza, alta densidad de habitantes por hectárea, falta de espacios para recreación y escasa oferta laboral. El desarrollo económico ha circulado en torno al sector  micro empresarial de productos básicos (alimentos, vestuario, zapatos, licores, etc.).
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the communal bank “Adonay” of Cerro Navia, Santiago. She has run a small bakery for the past 7 years, preparing items at home and selling them to local customers.  Her most popular items are empanadas with various fillings such as seafood and cheese.  Her heaviest work is from Thursday through Sunday.  She buys her ingredients in markets or commercially, and seeks this credit to buy a stock of ingredients to support her bakery.
Ana was ill for some time and unable to work, but now feels better and lives gratefully for every new day which allows her to work and sustain herself. She lives with her mother and a 26-year old son who is looking for work and helps out in the bakery.  Ana hopes to regain her full health and dreams someday of living outside of the city of Santiago.  She is very pleased with the services of Fondo Esperanza, and her interaction with the group has been a valuable experience. 
Cerro Navia is a neighborhood of metropolitan Santiago (the capital of Chile) noted for its high poverty rate, crowded urban conditions, lack of parks and high unemployment.   Small businesses sustain many in this region, and sell items such as food, clothing, shoes, licor, etc.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to support her bakery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: La señora Sonia se dedica a la venta de distintos productos de belleza y ropa para dama; es así como consigue sus ingresos para la manutención suya y la de su hijo que está en la Universidad. El crédito lo requiere para la cancelación de estudios universitarios para su hijo. Vive en casa propia  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Miraflores en la ciudad de La Paz; Sonia es separada y tiene un  hijo. Ella es cliente des IMPRO desde el año  2008 y siempre ha cumplido con sus obligaciones financieras.
texts.en: Sonia sells various beauty products and women’s clothes; this is how she earns income to support herself and her son who is in university.  She needs the loan to pay her son’s university expenses.  She lives in her own house located in the city of La Paz’s Miraflores zone.  Sonia is separated and has a son.  She has been an IMPRO client since 2008 and has always met her financial obligations.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition.

loans.name: Fidel Angel

texts.es:
Fidel, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad, es empleado pero además trabaja en el cultivo de maíz y frijol, su trabajo es como promotor de proyectos sociales de la Alcaldía Municipal, pero además es agricultor en sus momentos libres atiende las tareas de la agricultura.
El quiere invertir un préstamo en abono para sus cultivos, ya que con este insumo fortalecerá la plantación, garantizándole un buen desarrollo y producción.
Su propósito es que sus hijos sientan su apoyo, que aprovechen sus estudios y se superen en el futuro.
texts.en:
Fidel lives with his wife and two children, ages 10 and 8. He is employed but also grows corn and beans. He works as a promoter of social projects for his municipality but he is also a farmer in his free time and does agricultural tasks. 
He wants to use his loan to buy fertilizer thereby strengthening his fields and guaranteeing good development and production.
His goal is for his children to feel they have his support so they will do well in their studies and excel in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 42 years old and married and with two children in school. For the past five years, he has run a photography business and he works as a cameraman. Previously, he earned a living as a farmer. He has benefited from Faulu Kenya because he has learned how to save his money.

Francis is requesting a 70,000 KES to buy cameras. In the future, he hopes to venture into the real estate business.

loans.use: to buy camera

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 46 years old and married with four children, all of whom go to school. For the past ten years, he has been selling shoes to earn a living. Previously, he sold scrap metals. John also raises chickens to supplement his income. He is very grateful to Faulu Kenya because he has managed to pay school fees and educate his children.

John is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy shoes to sell and also increase the number of chickens on his farm. In the future, he hopes to open other shoe outlets.

loans.use: to buy shoes and chickens

loans.name: Juan Luis

texts.es: El Sr. Juan es casado, tiene 4 hijos todos mayores de edad; el Sr. Juan se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi por toda la ciudad de Ica; él lo hace en un auto alquilado, se dedica a brindar este servicio por más de 15 años; gana aproximadamente S/. 350 nuevos soles semanales; el crédito otorgado lo va a invertir en la compra de su propio auto, ya que cuenta con unos ahorros y lo quiere completar con el crédito. Su principal desafío es estar expuesto a las peligrosidades de las calles; su sueño es tener 2 autos propios mas para hacer crecer su negocio. El Sr. Juan está muy agradecido por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Juan is married and he has four grown children. Juan offers a taxi service throughout the entire city of Ica and he does this in a rented car. He has made his living offering this service for more than fifteen years and he earns approximately 350 PEN per week. 

He will invest the loan granted by purchasing his own car, since he already has some savings and he wants to use the loan to complete the purchase. His main challenge is exposure to the dangers on the streets. His dream is to have two cars of his own so he can grow his business. Juan is very thankful for the loan granted to him.

loans.use: to buy his own car.

loans.name: Twisungane/ Rbv Group

texts.fr:
Télésphore fait partie du groupe Twisungane. Il est né au Rwanda et a 31 ans. Il est marié et il a 5 enfants de 1 à 13 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire. 
Télésphore est agriculteur. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter 50 kg de pommes de terre, 50 kg d’engrais et payer la main d’œuvre. 
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d‘augmenter la capacité. Dans les prochaines années, Télésphore voudrait devenir une grande agriculteur dans son secteur et bâtir une autre maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Télésphore is part of the group Twisungane. He was born in Rwanda. He is 31 years old and married, and he has five children, aged 1 to 13 years. Four of the children are in school. He has a 6th grade education.

Télésphore is a farmer. This loan cycle is his first one with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy 50 kg of potatoes and 50 kg of manure and to cover the cost of labor. 

His strategy for business growth is to increase his capacity. In the next few years, Télésphore would like to become a major farmer in his sector and to build another house for his family.

loans.use: to buy 50 kg of potatoes and 50 kg of manure, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Constance

texts.fr:
Notre cliente, âgée de 46 ans est  mariée et  mère de 5 enfants dont l’âge varie de 7 et 20ans.
La vente des friperies   a commencer avec sa grand mère, sa mère et enfin  ses sœurs et elle, c’est une affaire de famille qui va de génération en générations.
Ce quatrième crédit qu’elle va avoir avec Hope, va lui permettre de renforcer ce qu’elle a déjà acquis avec les trois premiers prêts.
Ces ventes journalières sont de 75000f quand les temps sont durs et de atteint 200.000F pendant les périodes favorables. Elle est parmi l'une  des  clients qui a plus épargnée.
Avec  l’actuel prêt, elle va acheter 1ballot des serviettes, 1ballot des draps, 1ballot des couettes, 1ballot des robes de soirées et ensemble  tailleurs dames  et ballots des coussins et poufs.
Toujours en quête des articles  de qualités   supérieures, elle vend presque tous les jours  en faisant des prix promotionnels pour  augmenter ses  revenus,   elle  diversifie ses marchandises pour attirer  de clients.
C’est une mère de famille très active  dans le commerce et très attentionné pour son époux et ses enfants.
Son but est  de vendre beaucoup, faire plus de bénéfices et acheter plus de marchandises, car son projet d’ouvrir un dépôt de vente de friperie en gros lui tient à cœur.
texts.en:
Our client is 46 years old, married, and the mother of five children, from 7 to 20 years old. Selling second-hand clothing began with her grandmother, then her mother, and finally her sisters and her. It is a family affair handed down from generation to generation. 

This fourth loan she is obtaining with HOPE will enable her to bolster what she has already acquired from the three previous loans. Daily sales amount to 75,000 francs when times are difficult, and they reach 200,000 francs when times are favorable. She is among those clients who have saved the most. 

With the current loan, she is going to buy a bale of napkins, a bale of bed sheets, a bale of comforters, a bale of evening dresses and women's ensembles, and some bales of pillows and floor cushions. 

Always seeking items of superior quality, she is able to sell something everyday by offering promotional prices for increasing her revenues. She is diversifying her merchandise to attract customers. 

Our client is a mother who is very active in commerce and very attentive to her husband and children. Her goal is to make many sales, to make more profit, and to buy more merchandise to sell because she holds dear to her heart a plan to open a warehouse selling used-clothing wholesale.

loans.use: to buy bales of bed sheets, napkins, floor cushions, women's ensembles, comforters, and pillows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy utensils and ingredients such as sugar, wheat flour and tea leaves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy firewood, cured meats and dairy products.

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es:
Carlos Eduardo tiene 33 años de edad, es soltero, vive con el hijo de trece años de edad  en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C NUEVOS UNIDOS, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia  San José del Tambo, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz y cacao, arroz, naranja, plátano, café.

Carlos Eduardo se dedica al cultivo de maíz y cacao, arroz, naranja, plátano, café, etc. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo cada fin de semana.
 
Solicita el crédito para compra de abonos e insumos, fertilizantes, abonos agrícolas,  para sus cultivos. El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño de aquí a cinco años es poderse comprar una casa para poderle dejar a su hijo.

Le gusta escuchar música, salir y compartir momentos amenos junto a su hijo y  amigos.
texts.en:
Carlos Eduardo is 33 years old, single and living with his 13-year-old son in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “Nuevos Unidos” (New United Ones) communal bank is located in San José del Tambo Parish belonging to Chillanes Canton.  The members of this communal bank are farmers, especially of corn, cocoa beans, rice, banana, oranges and coffee.

Carlos Eduardo farms corn, cocoa beans, rice, oranges, bananas, coffee, etc.  He makes his purchases and sells his products at the San José del Tambo market every weekend.

He requests the loan to buy farming supplies: fertilizer and manure for his crops.  The loan will help him meet his economic needs and improve his farming activities.  The challenges he faces are drops in prices of the products he sells as well as dealing with middlemen.  His five-year plan is to be able to buy a house to leave to his son.

He enjoys listening to music, going out and sharing pleasant moments with his son and friends.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Flor Kantuta Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR KANTUTA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Collpani, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Fortunata. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Trenzado de mantas, faenado de chancho, bordado de ropa de moreno, hilado de manta de vicuña, cría de gallina y chancho, producción de leche, tienda de barrio, costura de chamarras, costura de camperas.
 
La señora Fortunata,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de la promotora de crédito. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de confección de chamarras que viene trabajando hace siete años, aprendiendo el mismo de su esposo. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de máquina recta que servirá para realizar la costura de sus productos, posterior a la elaboración ella distribuye sus productos por entrega directa. Esta forma de trabajo le permitirá generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

En la fotografía no se encuentra la señora Zulma, ya que feu a realizar consulta médica
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta capacitación, salud y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The “Flor Kantuta” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Center.  It has nine members led by a governing board headed by Fortunata.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of business activities such as: blanket weaving, butchering pigs, embroidery work, vicuña wool blanket weaving, raising pigs and chickens, milk production, neighborhood store, jacket making, leather jacket making.

Fortunata says that this is the first time she’s joined Pro Mujer and that she joined thanks to an invitation from a loan promoter.  She currently sews jackets; she’s been in business seven years having learned from her husband.

The loan she’ll take out now is to buy a straight stitch sewing machine that will help her sew her products.  After she makes them she sells them via direct deliveries.  This method of work allows her to earn income to support her family as much as possible since she’s married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answers that she likes the training, the health services and the savings.

Zulma does not appear in the photo because she had to keep a medical appointment.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anjeline

texts.en: Anjeline is 35 years old, married and has 5 children. She does tailoring to earn a living for her family. She has retained her business for 7 years because of her good services. She also runs a green grocery for extra income. Anjeline has gained a lot of business management skills through the trainings conducted by Faulu Kenya. She hopes to expand the business and employ more people. She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is 59 years old, married and has 4 children. He does poultry farming to earn a living for his family. He has managed to retain his business for 3 years through the financial support from Faulu Kenya. Edward hopes that one day he will build houses for rental to generate more income. He has requested a loan for 45,000 KES to buy chicks and chick mash and to renovate the poultry house.

loans.use: To buy chicks and chick mash and to renovate the poultry house

loans.name: Amadeo

texts.es: Amadeo de cuarenta y cinco años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijos. El  posee una tienda la cual es muy conocida en la zona donde residen pues es la más surtida, siempre tienen lo que el cliente necesita,  los productos que don Amadeo comercia son de muy buena calidad y los da a excelentes precios a eso agrega su buena voluntad y animo de trabajar siempre atiende a las personas que lo visitan con el mejor de los gustos con una sonrisa en el rostro; Amadeo quiere ver crecer su negocio y el espíritu sobresaliente que lo caracteriza lo ha impulsado a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, aceite, productos instantáneos, condimentos, jabón entre otros. Amadeo tiene fe que incrementando la variedad en su negocio, dada la demanda de sus clientes, podrá darle a su familia seguridad económica y una vida mejor.
texts.en: Amadeo is 45 years old and lives with his life partner and their children. He owns a shop which is well-known in the area where they live as it is the most well-stocked and always has what the customer needs. The products Mr Amadeo sells are of very good quality, excellent price and in good taste. In addition, his kindness and willingness to work hard means that he serves everyone who visits his shop with a smile on his face. Amadeo wants to grow his business and the remarkable business spirit that characterizes it. He is therefore asking INTEGRAL for a loan with which to buy basic grains, oil, instant products, seasonings, soap and the like. Amadeo believes that increasing the variety of his products, given the demands of his customers, will give his family financial security and a better life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, oil, instant products, seasonings, soap

loans.name: Iris Elizabeth

texts.es: La Sra. Iris es casada, tiene un hijo de un año de edad; la Sra. Iris se dedica a la venta de comida, golosinas, gaseosas cerca al Hospital Regional; viene trabajando por más de 4 años en este negocio, ganando a la semana S/ 450 nuevos soles. La Sra. Iris va a invertir el crédito otorgado en ampliar su negocio de comidas, su principal desafío es trabajar todo el día hasta la madrugada soportando el frio de la noche; su sueño es tener su casa propia y su restaurante en el centro de la cuidad. Ella está muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en: Iris is married and has a one-year old son. She sells food, sweets, and soft drinks near the Regional Hospital. Iris has been working in this business for more than four years, earning 450 Peru Nuevo Soles (PEN) weekly. Iris is going to invest the loan she has been offered to increase her food business. Her main challenge is working all day long until the early morning, enduring the cold night. Her dream is to have her own house and restaurant in the center of the city. She is very grateful for the loan she has been offered.

loans.use: To increase her food business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is is 41 years old. She is married and blessed with six children between 4 and 17 years. For the last 7 years, she has been raising pigs so as to meet the needs of her family.  She supplements income from this venture with the earnings she makes from running a grocery shop. She wants, in the next 5 years, to have more than 100 pigs. Her dream is to be a major supplier of poultry products and pigs.

She is requesting for a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to start a business of raising laying chickens. Thanks to Faulu Kenya she is now able to produce and earn more from her business.

loans.use: to buy laying chickens

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El comité 8 D. Diciembre se conformó con la iniciativa D. la señora Raquel que se mostró muy interesada por el programa, están en el primer ciclo actualmente con 10 mujeres, todas trabajan D. forma conjunta D. manera a poder desarrollarse, no solo económicamente, sino también a nivel personal. El objetivo del comité es el D. aprender la importancia D. trabajar en equipo dentro D. un grupo con responsabilidad, honestidad y comunicación.
La señora Raquel se dedica a la cría y venta D. animales. Comenta que es un trabajo muy sacrificado, ya que se levanta a muy tempranas horas y trabaja hasta muy tarD.. El cuidado D. los animales es una tarea muy complicada ya que se debe D. estar pendiente D. los animales, en todo sentido. Le gustaría poder tener un terreno más amplio, donD. pueda tener más animales.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. animales, como así también alimento para los mismos. Está con las esperanzas en el crédito, ya que le será D. gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The "8 D. Diciembre" committee was formed on the initiative of Señora Raquel, who was very interested by the program.  They are in their first lending cycle currently, with ten women.  All of them work together to be able to develop themselves, not just financially, but also on a personal level.  The goal of the committee is to learn the importance of working in a team within the group, with responsibility, honesty and communication.

Señora Raquel works raising and selling animals.  She says that is is very self-sacrificing work, and that she gets up at a very early hour and works till very late.  The care of the animals is a very complicated task as she must keep an eye on the animals, in every sense.  She would like to be able to have a larger field in which she can have more animals.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of more animals, and also food for them.  She has high hopes for this loan, as it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy animals and food for them.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 37 year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with three children, of whom two are in school. He has been operating an entertainment service for the last 5 years. Previously he was employed by someone else. He wants, in the next 5 years, to have opened up a music shop. His dream is to excel in the music industry.

He is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy a video camera. Thanks to Faulu Kenya he is now more business-minded.

loans.use: to buy a video camera

loans.name: Rachidatou

texts.fr:
Rachidatou est une femme âgée de 38 ans. Elle est veuve et a 02 enfants en charge.
Rachidatou travaille comme revendeuse des objets de prières musulmanes depuis 2005. Elle vend avec une personne à ADOBOUKOME et achète les produits à Lomé. Rachidatou a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des articles de prières.
texts.en:
Rachidatou is a 38 years old woman. She is widowed and has two children in her care.
Rachidatou has been working as a retailer of Muslim devotional objects since 2005. She sells with another person in Adoboukome and purchases the products in Lome. Rachidatou has requested her first loan cycle from WAGES in order to purchase devotional objects.

loans.use: to buy Muslim devotional objects.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz trabaja como profesora en el colegio de Educación Pública Las Nieves de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo requiere para el acabado en obra fina de una habitación en su casa, para dar mayor comodidad a sus hijos. Vive en casa propia   ubicada en la zona Vino Tinto de la ciudad de La Paz; es madre soltera  y tiene dos hijos. Con un crédito anterior, también a través de Kiva, pudo terminar la facha da de su casa, por lo que se encuentra muy agradecida con los financiadores de Kiva.
texts.en:
Beatriz works as a professor at the Las Nieves College of Public Education in the city of La Paz.  The loan she is requesting will be used to complete the finishing touches on a room in her home so that it will be more comfortable for her children.  Beatriz lives in her own home in the District of Vino Tinto in the city of La Paz.  She is a single mother and has two children.  

Her previous loan was also with Kiva and the funds were used to complete the façade of her house.  Beatriz is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy materials such as fine sand, paint, electrical outlets, and other items in order to finish a room in her home.

loans.name: Freddy Saul

texts.es:
Freddy Saúl  tiene 33 años de edad, es soltero, vive solo en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
 
La V.R.C NUEVOS UNIDOS, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia  San José del Tambo, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz y cacao, arroz, naranja, plátano, café.

Freddy Saúl se dedica al cultivo de maíz y cacao, arroz, naranja, plátano, café, etc. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo cada fin de semana. 

Solicita el crédito para compra de abonos e insumos, fertilizantes, abonos agrícolas,  para sus cultivos. El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es poderse comprar una casa para llegar a tener una familia.

Le gusta escuchar música, y visitar a sus padres.
texts.en:
Freddy Saúl is 33 years old, single, and lives alone in the canton of Chillanes in Bolívar Province.

The Communal Bank “Nuevos Unidos” is located in the parish of San José del Tambo, which is part of the canton of Chillanes.  The members of this Communal Bank are farmers who grow mainly corn, cacao, oranges, bananas, and coffee.

Freddy Saúl grows corn, cacao, oranges, bananas, coffee, and other crops.  He buys his supplies and sells his products at the market in San José del Tambo each weekend.

Freddy Saúl is requesting a loan to buy supplies, fertilizers, and agricultural composts for his crops.  This loan provides the support to meet his financial needs and improve his farming activities.  The challenges he faces include the falling prices of the products he sells to people, such as middlemen.  His dream is to buy a house so that he can start a family.

Freddy Saúl enjoys listening to music and visiting his parents.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizers, and compost for his crops.

loans.name: Orcy Edgardo

texts.es: Orcy Edgardo, vive con su grupo familiar en una zona urbana y muy concurrida en el norte del país, es por eso que él posee un negocio de ciber, copiado o fotocopias, el lugar es muy estratégico y últimamente ha recibido más clientes, quienes en su mayoria son estudiantes de escuelas y colegios cercanos que llegan a realizar sus tareas ex-aulas, la conectividad en su lugar es excelente, muy buena calidad de las copias, anillados, laminados y otros es excelente, además que tiene precios accesibles y su servicio es inigualable siempre a la disposición de las personas; Orcy Edgardo es un hombre con sueños muy entregado al trabajo, él piensa que todos tenemos el derecho de producir felicidad y el está dispuesto a producir la suya, es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar tinta para copiador, hojas bond por mayor, plástico para laminar entre otros. Orcy tiene la esperanza que de esta forma logrará darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Orcy Edgardo lives with his family in a busy urban area in northern El Salvador. He owns a business that provides Internet, printing, and photocopying services. His business is located in a very strategic place, so he has recently received more customers. Most of them are elementary and high school students from nearby who come to do their homework and other extracurricular activities. The Internet connectivity in his location is excellent and he offers other high-quality services such as photocopying, three-ring binding, and laminations. His prices are affordable and his service is unequaled and always available to anyone who needs it.

Orcy Edgardo is a man who has dreams that involve his work. He believes that everyone has the right to produce happiness and is willing to produce his own. For this reason, he has requested a loan from Apoyo Integral so that he can buy ink for his copier, bond paper in bulk, plastic lamination sheets, and other supplies. Orcy is hopeful of providing his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy photocopier ink, bond paper, plastic lamination sheets, and other supplies.

loans.name: Las Dulcineas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS DULCINEAS.” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Cielo. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: kiosco de café, artesanías en alpaca, venta de sábanas, venta de edredones, penta de productos AVON y venta de productos YAMBAL

La señora Cielo, indica que hace es la primera ves que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de café, que lo realiza en un kiosco.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de pan, carne, etc.) ya que implementará un nuevo servicio, que es la venta de hamburguesas. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Dulcineas” is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Juan Pablo II Community Center. The group consists of six members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Cielo. The members of the Communal Bank engage in various businesses in order to get ahead such as operating a coffee kiosk, making crafts from alpaca wool, selling bed sheets, selling quilts, selling AVON products, and selling Yanbal products.
