Miguela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Miguela has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 8 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Miguela aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase items to sell in her sari-sari store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cristal

texts.en:
Cristal, 19 and single, lives in Ilagan. She is a very good daughter who, wanting to help her family cover household expenses, three years ago started a small business. She has a small, home-based grocery store where she sells all sorts of products like: rice, sugar, oil and detergent, among others. She works daily from 6am until 8pm and sometimes even later. Her parents help her when they can. With help from the loans she hopes to gradually improve the business over time.

She will use this loan to stock her store more. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cured meats and other basic-need items. Her goals are to stay in business and that her store grows more every day and also to invest and save for her future.

loans.use: to buy oil, drinks and sugar for her store.

loans.name: Ma. Sol

texts.en:
Ma. Sol is 52 years old and married with 3 children.

Ma. Sol works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her store. Ma. Sol has borrowed and re-paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 23 years and also earns an income from carenderia (mini-restaurant) and rice retailling.

Ma. Sol aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell in her store

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda, a 44-year-old mother of two children aged 15 and 7, is married to a farmer. A farmer herself, Melinda assists her husband in managing their rice farm situated in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. She also manages their sari-sari store business, selling items including bath and detergent soap, shampoo, sugar and vinegar.

Melinda is requesting a loan to buy farm such as fertilizers and insecticides, and hopes the loan will help to increase their yield.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Lisonia

texts.en:
Lisonia, a 49-year-old-woman, is married. Her family humbly settled for a living in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Addressing daily needs of her five grown children or the whole family is not an easy thing to do and think about every day. She engaged in farming activity to answer those demands and to augment her spouse's irregular means of income. She started plowing and cultivating this land 4 years ago. At the end of the month, she gets PHP 5,000 total of income.

Lisonia is a GDMPC member, joining this year 2011. She begins her loan transaction with the cooperative by borrowing PHP 5,000  which she intends to use to purchase farm fertilizers to elevate production. She hopes that with this input, she can bring in a good return on her investment. Lisonia also plans to work on other farm fields as a tenant and buy a weeding tool when she gets adequate income after this or subsequent periods of production.

loans.use: To purchase farm fertilizers to elevate production.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is a 40-year-old married woman with three children. The oldest child is 18 years old.

Rhoda is engaged in farming and hog-raising businesses. Her husband mainly manages their rice farm and she assists in keeping the farm free of weeds and pests. Rhoda raises pigs in their backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them at the market.

Rhoda has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pig feed. She hopes for their ventures to prosper.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pig feed.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 46 years old and married. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines together with her spouse and three dependents. Farming is the commoner's means of income which she belongs too. She has been weeding, plowing and planting for the past four years of her life 'til the present time but is enjoying the job, despite its difficulties. Viriginia normally receives PHP 8,000 a month from all sources of income.

Virginia currently joined GDMPC  to have access to financial services offered by the organization and to be socially recognized. She is known for good credibility as per communal background. Her first loan application of PHP 5,000 has been approved. The purpose of borrowing is to buy insecticides/pesticides for the farm to prevent hazardous creatures that could hinder the plants' growth. Virginia is hopeful to obtain adequate income from this additional investment and gets the chance of attaining her plan of growing productive crops so she can earn more.

loans.use: To buy insecticides/pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Rose Jean

texts.en:
Rose Jean is 36 years old and married. She has a 9-year-old child. Rose Jean’s husband is a farmer.

Rose Jean is also a farmer. She helps her husband plant rice crops and keep them healthy. She also manages their small sari-sari  (variety) store where items like noodles and canned goods are sold.

Rose Jean requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to save for her child’s future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a residence of Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines, a place where farming is the common source of income. She is 53 years old and married. She has six grown dependents who have helped her in farm work during leisure times or when they have no classes and jobs to attend to. Her spouse is a carpenter but is not permanent so they are both engaged in farming to lift up cash inflows for the family. The business began five years ago and is still doing well today. Every month, she gets PHP 6,000 total in income.

This year 2011, Elena became part of GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to compensate irrigation cost and fertilizers for plants' quick growth. By applying suitable fertilizers to the plants, she hopes to have a good harvest. The revenue thereof and from succeeding business cycles will be used to invest in gardening activity to produce high-yielding crops as additional income.

loans.use: To compensate irrigation cost and fertilizers.

loans.name: Dianisa

texts.es: Dianisa tiene 24 años, es una mujer encantadora, muy alegre y dinámica para el trabajo, es madre soltera de un niño de 2 años. Vive en su casa propia junto a su padre, su hijo y su sobrina quienes dependen mucho de ella. El trabajo de Dianisa consiste en la venta de ropa y productos por catálogos, este trabajo lo hace ya desde hace unos cuatro años, lo hace en su casa y cuando no hay clientes cerca sale a vender sus productos por la carretera y entre sus compañeras de trabajo, ya que labora en una embotelladora por medio día. A Dianisa le encanta su trabajo, le gusta estar en contacto con la gente, como es alegre siempre anda sonriente y tiene muy buenos clientes, en el futuro quisiera instalar una bodega, así logrará aumentar sus ingresos. Este es el crédito número 8 con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continuar con su trabajo, pues se siente muy agradecida por los prestamos recibidos anteriormente, ya que fueron muy bien utilizados. Con el monto solicitado, comprará productos como variedad de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Dianisa is 24 years old and is a lovely woman who is very lively and energetic about her work.  She is a single mother of a 2 year old.  She lives in her own house with her father, her son and her niece, who rely heavily on her. 

Dianisa's work involves the sale of clothing and products from catalogs, which she has been doing for four years.  She works from home and when there are no customers around, she goes out to sell their products out on the street and among her fellow employees, as she works in a bottling plant for half the day.

Dianisa loves her job.  She likes to be in contact with people as she's always smiling and happy, and she has very good customers.  In the future, she would like to open a store, and in this way be able to increase her income. 

This loan is her 8th with MFP;  therefore she hopes for the support of every one of you to continue her work.  She feels very grateful for the loans she received previously, as they were used to good effect. With the amount requested, she will buy products such as a variety of clothing.

loans.use: to buy more clothing.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 58-year-old married woman with 3 children who are 27, 26 and 19 years old. She is a farmer who tills land in Surallah, South Cotabato. Ruth grows rice and fruit trees on her land, selling her harvest to the people in her community.

Ruth has requested a loan to purchase farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizers and insecticides. She hopes for this loan to help improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh was born in 1979 and lives in the village of Nghia Lai, Uy No commune. She has three children (two sons and a daughter). Her husband repairs bicycles and motorbikes. Her family has a store where Anh has worked for many years. The store provides a monthly income of about 7,000,000 VND.

Anh has participated in SEDA since 2005. She last borrowed 8,938,000 VND and repaid the loan punctually. This will be her 6th loan from SEDA. Anh would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy motorcycle parts.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara tiene 40 años, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos de 22, 19, 13,  y 12 años, vive en su casa propia junto a ellos. El trabajo de Sara consiste en la venta de carbón y leña los cuales consiguen en un aserradero de la ciudad, vende estos productos en su casa, lleva ya nueve años en este trabajo, actividad que lo realiza sola. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene disponibilidad de tiempo, para hacer otras actividades. Espera en adelante implementar bien su casa ya que quiere iniciar el negocio de venta de habitaciones, y le falta un poco de inversión para terminar de construir. Este es el crédito número 16 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para seguir adelante con sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado, comprará madera y carbón para tener en stock.
texts.en:
Sara is 40 years old, and a single mother of four children aged 22, 19, 13, and 12.  She lives with them in her own house.

Sara's work involves selling coal and firewood, which she gets from a sawmill in town.  She sells these products from her home.  She has been doing this work for nine years now, and works on her own.  What she likes about her work is having time available to take part in other activities.  

She hopes in the future to be able to improve her house, and wants to start a business selling rooms.  She needs a small investment to be able to finish the construction.

This is her 16th loan through MFP, therefore she is hoping for your collaboration for her to be able move forward with her goals.  With the requested amount, she will buy wood and coal to keep in stock.

loans.use: to buy wood and coal.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en: Hai, who was born in 1979, lives in Nghia Lai, Uy No, Dong Anh with her husband and two sons. Her first son earns an income and her second son attends school. Hai's husband is a builder and Hai is a hairdresser. She has a salon where she helps people to become more beautiful. She has had this job for 6 years, earning a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND. Hai has participated in SEDA since 2005 and has always repaid her loans punctually. She would now like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to repair her salon.

loans.use: to repair her salon

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga was born in 1971 and lives in Nghia Lai-Uy No –Dong Anh. She is married and has one young child. Nga's husband is a soldier and she is a farmer. Nga has operated a restaurant, selling rice, noodles, etc. for many years. She earns a monthly income of about 5,500,000 VND.

Nga has participated in SEDA since 2005 and has repaid her loans punctually. She would now like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to invest in her restaurant by buying more chairs, tables, etc. in order to earn more money.

loans.use: to buy more chairs, tables, etc.

loans.name: Alida

texts.es: Alida, de 34 años, es una mujer emprendedora y sobre todo muy trabajadora, convive con su pareja con quien tiene tres hijos de 15, 7 y 1 años de edad. Juntos habitan en su casa propia. El trabajo de Alida consiste en realizar todo sobre carpintería metálica, (sillas, mecedoras, puertas, etc). Este trabajo lo hace desde hace casi siete años, su taller se encuentra instalada en su casa y cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su pareja con quien forman un buen grupo de trabajo. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede trabajar junto a su pareja y sus hijos, además tiene buenos clientes y cuando no hay trabajo, se encarga de salir a la calle a ofrecer lo que fabrica. Espera en adelante terminar de construir su casa y acondicionar un espacio para su negocio. Este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, por tanto espera poder pagar todas sus cutas de manera puntual para no perjudicar a sus demás compañeras de grupo comunal. Con el monto solicitado, comprará fierros para seguir fabricando sillas y mecedoras.
texts.en: Alida, 34, is a very enterprising woman and above all, a very hardworking one. She lives with her partner with whom she has three children, 15, 7 and 1 years of age. Together they live in their own home. Alida’s work consists of metallic carpentry (chairs, rocking chairs, doors, etc). She has been doing this work for seven years. Her workshop is in her house and she has the wholehearted support of her partner with whom she forms a good working partnership. What she likes about her work is that she can do it together with her partner and their children. In addition she has a good clientele and when there is no work, she is in charge of going on the street to sell what she makes. She hopes in the near future to finish construction on her house and remodeling a space for her business. This is her first loan with MFP and she expects to be able to make all of her payments on time in order not to penalize other members of her communal bank. With the sum requested, she will buy iron so she can continue making chairs and rockers.

loans.use: to buy iron.

loans.name: Dante

texts.en:
This is Dante, 45 years old and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Dorotea, a housewife and mother to their four children. Dante and his wife manage their own household while operating the business. Dante works hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Dante operates a variety store which, in the Philippines, is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Dante earns an income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house and his regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 350 in daily sales.

To help him continue operations of his business, Dante is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Dante hopes to be able to expand soon, just as he hopes to support his children's schooling up to the college level. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand product inventory

loans.name: Khanh

texts.en:
Khanh was born in 1974. She lives in Nghia Lai village. She is married with two children who are going to school. Her husband is a driver. He has a monthly income of about 7,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). Her family has a store. Mrs Khanh has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. 

Since 2004 she has participated in SEDA. This is the eighth time she is borrowing money in SEDA. This time, she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy goods to resell. She wants to earn more money to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy goods to resell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 42 años, esta casada y vive en casa propia junto a sus tres hijos de 16, 11 y 10 años y su esposo. EL trabajo de María, consiste en la venta de productos por catalogo, este trabajo lo hace en su casa ya que es ama de casa y al mismo tiempo utiliza su tiempo para poder ofrecer sus productos entre sus amigos, vecinos y familiares. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tiempo para su hogar y al mismo tiempo generar ingresos para su economía, siempre tiene clientes ya que los mantiene por que son muy buenos pagadores, espera mantener ahí nomás o quizá mas adelante comprar una vitrina donde pueda mostrar sus productos. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP, agradece mucho la oportunidad de trabajar con la institución y espera poder seguir así por varios años mas. Con el monto solicitado, comprará productos para tener en stock, ya que mientras más pide sus clientes más porcentaje de ganancia tiene.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old and married.  She lives in her own house with her husband and their three children, ages 16, 11, and 10.  María sells products by catalog.  She does this work at home because she is a housewife.  At the same time she uses her time to be able to offer her products to her friends, neighbors, and relatives.

What she likes about her work is that it allows her time for her home, and at the same time it allows her to generate income.  She always has customers, and she keeps them because they pay very well.  She hopes to keep it as it is, or perhaps later on she will buy a showcase where she would be able to display her products.

This is her ninth loan with MFP.  She is very grateful for the opportunity of working with the institution.  She hopes to be able to continue this way for several more years.  She will use the requested loan to buy products to have in stock.  The more her customers ask for, the greater percentage of income she has.

loans.use: to buy more products like clothes and home accessories.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn, 30, resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Luciben, her business partner.  She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Evelyn operates a rolling store. Her rolling store is basically a small housewares store which retails plastic containers, dippers, pails plastic flowers or basins to the local neighborhood. Her husband drives the rolling store within the local community to sell the products. Evelyn earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php700 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 16,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy pails, plastic ware, hangers, clothes pins, plastic flowers and rags to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Evelyn dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of product items needed in her business.

loans.name: Anh's Group

texts.en:
Anh was born in 1974. She is married with two children who are going to school. Her husband is a soldier. He has a monthly income. Mrs Anh has a store at home where she sells various things to peopL. in her village. She has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). Since 2010 she has participated in SEDA. 

The last time she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. This time, she wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to repair her store. She is the leader of 4-member group loan in SEDA.

 About other borrowers in her group:

 Ha is 30 years old. She has one child. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to buy groceries.

 Linh is 30 years old. She has two children. She is a tailor. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy cloth.

 Lan is 24 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND for her small business.

loans.use: to repair her store.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталия не замужем. Она сама воспитывает сына подростка. Наталия проживает в Никополе. Там она торгует детской обувью. Занимается этим она уже 15 лет и говорит, что торговать обувью для детей хорошо тем, что мало конкурентов. Однако  в этом бизнесе есть и свои сложности, например, часто часть товара остается  невостребованной и нереализованной. Тем не менее, Наталия не опускает руки и не ленится развивать свой бизнес. На данный момент сумма в товаре у нее составляет больше 100 000 гривен. 

У Наталии есть качественный товар на любой кошелек и вкус, а, значит, всегда есть и спрос на товар и постоянные покупатели. Наталии необходим кредит в 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести осеннюю детскую обувь и получить новый ассортимент для бизнеса, что, в свою очередь даст продолжение ее бизнесу. У Наталии многолетний опыт работы, ее можно охарактеризовать как очень прилежного предпринимателя. Она умеет выбрать закупаемый товар.    

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Nataliya is single. She is raising a teenage son on her own. Nataliya lives in Nikopol. She sells children’s shoes. She has been in this business for 15 years. She says selling children’s shoes is good because there is not much competition. However, this business too has its difficulties; for example, often part of her stock remains unclaimed and unsold. Nevertheless, Nataliya does not give up and spares no effort in developing her business. At the moment she has  stocked goods worth over 100,000  UAH.

Nataliya offers quality wares for every budget and taste, which means her wares are in demand  and she has loyal customers. Nataliya needs a loan of 15,000  UAH in order to buy children’s shoes for the fall season and expand her stock, which will allow her to grow her business. Nataliya has many years of work  experience and may be described as a very steadfast entrepreneur. She knows how to select wares for resale.

Note: the lender profile is in Russian

loans.use: to buy children’s shoes for the fall season and expand her stock

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is 42 years old and lives in Manamong Aloran. He is married with three children. 

To earn a living, Manuel has a business selling canned goods, soft drinks, milk, sugar, etc. He earns about PHP 7,000 each month doing this type of work. Manuel has  requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more merchandise for his  snacks business.

Manuel has been a member of PMPC for three years.  Manuel would like to thank PMPC because PMPC helps him to add his capital of his sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for his  snacks business.

loans.name: Yaroslav

texts.ru:
Ярослав женат. Он занимается частным предпринимательством в Виноградово, где проживает вместе со своей семьей. Ярослав занимается продажей комнатных тапочек, летних сланцев и шлепок на центральном рынке своего родного городка. Его торговое место находится в самом центре рынка. Ярослав занимается этим видом деятельности уже на протяжении 5 лет. На данный момент у него в товаре около 45 000 гривен. Доход составляет 4 500 гривен. 

Ярославу необходим кредит на сумму в 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести 50 пар тапочек,  а также закупить осеннюю обувь для мужчин. Ярослав убежден, что увеличение количества товара поможет ему увеличить и получаемый доход. В будущем Ярослав хотел бы открыть еще одну торговую точку. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Yaroslav is married.  He makes his living in a private enterprise in Vinogradov, where he lives with his family.  He sells house slippers, flip-flops, and sandals in his hometown's central market.  His shop is located  at the center of the market.  He's been in the business for five years.  Right now he's got around 45,000 hryvnia in inventory and makes 4,500 hryvnia in income.

Yaroslav needs a loan of 20,000 hryvnia to purchase fifty pairs of slippers and some men's fall footwear.  He assures us that raising the quality of his product will allow him to increase his income.  In the future he would like to open another shop.

loans.use: to buy fifty pairs of slippers and men's fall footwear.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda owns a small sari-sari (variety) store in front of her house in the village where she lives together with her family. She had been managing it for two years. Allowances for her three children rely on her daily profit from the store. As of now, items in the store are already sold out. She needs to replenish it as soon as possible to get the attention of her neighborhood who might need a sachet of shampoo or instant noodles. So she is asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy soap, shampoo, instant noodles, canned goods, breads and eggs to sell in her sari-sari store and keep making better sales.

Melinda wants to stock more grocery items in her store for continuous sales and profits. In this way, she could save enough money for future expenses.

loans.use: to buy soap, shampoo, instant noodles, canned goods, breads and eggs to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Tinh's Group

texts.en:
Tinh was born in 1963 and lives in the village of Le Phap, Tien Duong commune, Dong Anh district. Tinh has a daughter who attends school. Her husband is an electrician and she is a farmer. Her main job is farming and breeding.

Tinh has participated in SEDA since 2009 and has always repaid her loans punctually. She would now like to borrow 654,000 VND to buy one pig.

About the other borrowers in her group:

Ha is 48 years old and has two children. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.

Du is 42 years old and has four children. She wants to borrow 3,706,000 VND to buy pig feed.

loans.use: to buy one pig.

loans.name: 69 Thieu Toan Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dinh  has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase dry food to resell.

Dinh is 35 years old and she is married with two children. Dinh is the group leader of the 69 Thieu Toan solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with her two dependents.

In 2009, Dinh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Dinh has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Dinh has been involved in this business for six years. The main hardship that Dinh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In future, Dinh hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to buy a motorbike, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase dry food to resell.

loans.name: 3.12.70 Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Phương operates a food stall selling processed food. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make processed food to sell.

Phương is 34 years old and she is married with two children. Phương is the group leader of the 3.12.70 Thieu Hoa solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with her two dependents.

This is Phương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Phương has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Phương faces in her business is not being able to meet the high demand for services.

In future, Phương hopes to build a new house, for her children to do well in school, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make processed food to sell.

loans.name: Abdurazok

texts.ru:
Абдуразок добрый и честный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Более 15 лет он занимается купля продажей крупного рогатого скота и выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Он покупает скот с других рынка районов, а затем продает на местном рынке. Он взял 1 га землю в аренду, и там выращивает картошку, помидоры, кукурузы и лука. Его семья помогает ему для посева семена и переработки земли. Абдуразок хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свой прибыль. Он запрашивает займ для покупки скота. Он заранее благодарит вас за вашу помощь и доброты. 
  
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Abdurazok is a kind and honest person.  He is a married and loving father of three children.  He has been involved in buying and selling cattle and growing agricultural crops for over 15 years.  He buys livestock at other district markets and then sells it at the local market.  Abdurazok leased a hectare of land and grows potatoes, tomatoes, corn and onions there.  His family helps him with sowing seeds and re-conditioning of the land.  Abdurazok wants to expand his business and maximize his profits.  He is requesting a loan for the purchase of livestock.  He thanks you in advance for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: 3.9.71 Thiệu Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Phúc works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future.

Phúc is 60 years old and she is married with two children. Phúc is the group leader of the 3.9.71 Thiệu Hóa  solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

This is Phúc's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Phúc has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Phúc faces in her business are natural disasters and droughts.

 Phúc hopes to maintain  a successful business, for her children to find a good job, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby  cattle to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Mukadaskhon

texts.ru: Мукадасхон проживает в городе Исфара. Возраст, 55 лет. Замужем, имеет двоих детей. Она занимается торговлей. Арендует торговую точку, где продает ткани. Этим видом деятельности Мукадасхон занимается пять лет. В торговле ей помогает ее муж. Она берет кредит для покупки новых видов тканей.
texts.en: Mukadaskhon lives in the city of Isfara.  She is 55 years old, married and has two children.  She is involved in retail sales and leases a retail outlet, where she sells fabrics.  Mukadaskhon has been involved in this business for five years.  Her husband helps her with the sales.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of new types of fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase new types of fabrics

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly de 27 años, es una mujer muy luchadora y fuerte, recién acaba de convertirse en madre y es un gran motivo para poder salir adelante y darle una buena alimentación y educación a su pequeña hija, vive en casa de su mamá junto a su pareja y sus cuñadas. El trabajo de Nelly consiste en la crianza de pollos, este trabajo lo hace en su casa y lleva ya por dos años en este trabajo, ella también es estudiante de educación de la universidad y costea sus estudios con la ganancia que le da este negocio, lo hace sola.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le da tiempo para hacer otras actividades, además ella aprovecha en vender sus pollos cuando esta en temporada de precio alto, y si baja demasiado lo hace en parrilladas o a la plancha y vende preparado, a ella le gustaría poder sacar su titulo de educación que le corresponde como egresada y agrandar la crianza de sus pollos. Este es el tercer préstamo que hace Nelly con la institución MFP, espera que le siga yendo bien en su grupo como le fue hasta ahora y espera poder seguir con el trabajo junto a la institución. Con el monto solicitado 1200 soles, ella comprar mas pollos bebes para seguir n la crianza y poder pagar sus cuotas a tiempo.
texts.en:
Nelly, age 27, is a very tenacious and strong woman.  She has just become a mother, and that is a great motive to be able to get ahead and give her little daughter good nutrition and education.  She lives in her mother’s house with her life partner and her sisters-in-law.

Nelly’s work consists of raising chickens.  She does this work at home, and she has been doing this work for two years.  She is also studying education at the university.  She pays for her education with the income from this business, and she does this by herself.

What she likes about her work is that it gives her time to do other activities.  Also, she takes advantage of the season when prices are high by selling her chickens then.  If prices decrease too much she barbecues or grills them and sells them prepared.

She would like to be able to get her degree in education that goes with being a graduate, and she would like to expand her business of raising chickens.

This is Nelly’s third loan with the MFP institution.  She hopes that it continues to go well for her in her group like it has so far.  She hopes to be able to continue working with the institution.  She will use the 1,200 soles that she has requested to buy more baby chickens in order to continue raising them and to be able to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is 51 years old, a college graduate who worked in an insurance company for ten years. When she got married, she preferred to stay in the barrio and operate a business. She has a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells candies, sardines, noodles, coffee and charcoal. They make charcoal as an additional item to sell in her store.

She has five children. Two of them already got married. Her youngest helps her with financial matters, and the rest are reviewing for licensed examination. Florentina is praying for their success.

Florentina is asking for the loan amount of P5,000 to buy soft drinks, breads and butter as additional items to sell in her store.

She wants to earn a higher income to sustain all the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, breads and butter to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.es: Rosana tiene 42 años, es madre soltera de dos niños de 8 y 2 años y medio, vive en casa de sus padres junto a ellos y sus hijos. El trabajo de Rosana consiste en la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, este trabajo lo hace en su casa, le ayudan sus padres y lleva ya con esto muchos años realizando esta actividad. Lo que le gusta de este trabajo es que tiene tiempo para su hogar y hacer otro tipo de trabajos o estar junto a sus hijos, le va regular ya que no es muy buena la venta y espera que mejore, por el momento prefiere mantenerse ahí ya que con lo que gana lo utiliza para los gastos del día. Por otro lado tiene como profesión de docencia, y los ingresos que recibe no le da abasto. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, le gusta mucho trabajar con este grupo por que hasta el momento se mostraron como personas muy responsables. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes para implementar su bodega y asi poder tener más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosana, age 42, is the single mother of two children, ages eight and two and a half.  She lives with her parents and her children in her parents’ house.

Rosana sells groceries and basic needs products.  She does this work at home, and her parents help her.  She has been doing this for a long time.

What she likes about this work is having time for her home, having time for other types of work, and being with her children.  It is going so-so for her because sales are not very good, and she hopes they will improve.  For now she prefers to keep it there because she uses what she earns for the daily expenses.  On the other hand, she is a teacher by profession.  The income she gets is not enough for the necessities.

This is her eighth loan with MFP.  She really likes working with this group because so far they have shown themselves to be very responsible people.

She will use the requested loan to buy more basic needs products and groceries to stock her store.  That way she will be able to have more variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy more products to stock her store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is an aggressive and hardworking 33-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with four children of whom three are in school. For the last three years she has been running a retail shop so as to make ends meet. She makes extra money by operating a beauty salon. 

She wants in the next five years to have expanded her business and her dream is to own a piece of land. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, rice and soap. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for making it easy for her to access credit to inject into her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and soap.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 46-year-old hardworking businessman. He is married and blessed with three children aged 21, 20 and 8, all of whom attend school. For more than 20 years, John has been selling drums and jerrycans to provide for his family. Within the next 5 years, he wants to have laid a firm foundation for his business to prosper and expand.

John is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to buy drums and jerrycans for sale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now able to access credit easily.

loans.use: to buy drums and jerrycans for sale

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, a determined 30-year-old businessman, is married and blessed with two children, one of whom attends school. To fend for his family, for the last six years David has been running a general shop selling various assorted items for household consumption.

Thanks to Faulu Kenya, David is now equipped with business management skills. He is requesting a loan of 40000 Kenya shillings to buy a water tank and kerosene pump in order to start selling kerosene. Within the next five years he hopes to open another retail shop.

loans.use: to buy a kerosene pump and water tank.

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en:
Milkah, age 24 (shown here with her husband), is a creative and focused individual. She is a dressmaker and also earns a small additional income by keeping livestock, a venture made possible by her involvement with Faulu Kenya. She and her husband have two children, one of whom is enrolled in school.

Milkah has been making and selling dresses for the last six years. Her goal is to expand her business over the next five years and to create employment opportunities for other people. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 Kenya shillings so as to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Mansur

texts.ru:
Мансур честный и целеустремленный человек. Она женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Он начал свой бизнес для того чтобы обеспечит свою семью так как у него большая семья и не хватает денег на обеспечение 3 детей. Он занимается купля продажей полиэтиленовые пакеты. Он имеет свою торговую точку на центре рынка города. Он покупает товар с других рынка города и продает на местом рынке. Мансур хотел бы получит кредит в размере 800$ США для покупки полиэтиленовые пакеты. Он заранее благодарен всем за поддержку и милосердие.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Mansur is an honest and goal-oriented person.  He is a married and loving father of three children.  He started his business in order to provide for his family because he has a large family and does not have enough money to support three children.  He is involved in buying and selling plastic bags.  He owns a retail outlet at the market in city center.  He buys merchandise from other city markets and sells it at the local market.  Mansur wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $800 for the purchase of plastic bags.  He thanks you in advance for the support and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase plastic bags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build classrooms for her nursery school

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a hardworking and self-motivated 27 year old business lady. She is married and blessed with a six-year-old child who is going to school. For the last 10 years, she has been selling auto spare parts so as to make a living. She makes an extra shillings by operating a mobile-phone money transfer business.

She wants in the next five years to be importing spare parts and selling locally. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy wipers, alternators, brake pads, and headlights. Thanks to Faulu Kenya she is now able to access finances to inject into her business.

loans.use: To buy wipers, alternators, brake pads, and headlights

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent, age 31, earns a living by selling glass. He has been engaged in his business for the last four years. Previously, he used to work in construction. He and his wife have a seven-year-old child who is enrolled in school.

Vincent is requesting a loan in the amount of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy glass to offer for sale. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for supporting him financially by providing easy access to finances.

His goal for the next five years is to transform his business into a hardware shop.

loans.use: to buy glass to offer for sale

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou, age 54, operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five Phillipine pesos worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Marilou earns her living by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. 

Marilou's store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 250 Philippine pesos (Php) in sales every day. She and her husband, Danilo, have one child and live in Pasay City. Danilo is a painter. Together they manage the household while operating the business. Marilou works hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Marilou hopes to be able to grow her business soon. 

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen lives in Uganda, is married and has two children, one of whom is in school. She lives in a rented home with access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

Allen has been a retail shopkeeper for less than a year and works seven days a week. She also makes additional money by plaiting hair.

Allen has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and small jerry cans of cooking oil. Transportation and seasonality are her main challenges.

Allen’s goals and aspirations include building rooms to rent and owning a wholesale rather than retail shop.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and small jerry cans of cooking oil.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 43 years old, married and blessed with four children, three of whom are in school. He has high self-esteem and a passion for success.

For the last five years Richard has been a taxi driver. He is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to buy tires and to repair and service his vehicle.

Within the next five years Richard wants to have bought another taxi. His dream is to be a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy tires and to repair and service his vehicle.

loans.name: Anna Mary

texts.en:
Anna Mary lives in Uganda, is married and has six children, none of whom are in school. She owns a home that has electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication and food for the family.

For the past ten years Anna Mary has sold charcoal, working seven days a week. She sells her charcoal at wholesale prices from her home. She also generates additional income by renting rooms.

Anna Mary has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. The main business challenges for her include transportation and seasonality.

Anna Mary’s goals and aspirations for her charcoal business are to own a delivery van and to build more rental rooms.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Merlin

texts.en:
Merlin, age 53, operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five Philippine pesos' worth worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Merlin earns her living by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. 

Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 Philippine pesos (Php) in sales every day. She lives on Pasay City. Her husband Pedro works overseas. Merlin manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Merlin hopes to be able to grow her business soon, as she also hopes to live a peaceful life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Gulrukhsor

texts.ru:
Гулрухсор честная, добросовестная и целеустремленная женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать 2 детей. Она занимается приготовлением национальных лепешек. Её муж и брат помогает ей в данном бизнесе. В день она производит около 220 шт. лепешек и раздает их в местных магазинах. Гулрухсор хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свой прибыль. Она хотела бы получит кредит в размере 750$ США на покупки муки для запаса. Она заранее благодарна всем за поддержку и поощрение. Спасибо вам!  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Gulrukhsor is an honest, conscientious and goal-oriented woman.  She is a married and loving mother of two children.  She is involved in cooking national flatbread.  Her husband and brother help her with this business.  She prepares about 220 flatbreads per day and delivers them to local stores.  Gulrukhsor wants to expand her business and maximize her profits.  She wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $750 for the purchase of flour.  She is thankful in advance to all for the help and support.  Thank you!

loans.use: to purchase flour

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan, 48, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Rodolfo, a driver; and mother to their child. She, together with her husband, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Susan operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Susan earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 870 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Susan hopes to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
The photo on this page is Gemma. She is 39 years old, married. Her residence is located in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, the capital city of the province. She has been rearing four school-aged dependents. Her spouse works as a fisherman. To increase the income for the family, she runs a retail store at home. The store operations commenced one year ago and it has shown noticeable potential for good earnings. The family is able to generate PHP 10,000 a month.

Last year 2010, Gemma became part of the GDMPC family. She is an official member joining that year. The previous loan made was successfully paid back. For the 2nd time, she is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 which was granted without hesitation. Her purpose for the money is to obtain a large volume of soft drinks to sell for a profit which she believes best suits the place of business. The expected revenue will be allotted for business expansion and spent for fishing boat maintenance to sustain their other source of livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase a large volume of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey is a man from Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is 30 years old, married and is rearing his three little kids together with his wife. He goes fishing frequently to satisfy the mouths to feed and other needs. He owns the fishing boat and is taking good care of it very well. At the end of the month, he gets PHP 5,000 income from said activity.

Earlier this year, he joined GDMPC to have an access to financial services. He is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 from the cooperative to purchase fishing boat motor parts to accelerate its speed. When the boat is again in good running condition, he expects to catch more and travel farther than the usual routes taken. The possible increased income is intended to expand the business by running even a small fish stall in their own place and sustain the livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase fishing boat motor parts to accelerate its speed.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
This is Mercedes, 55, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines, a  widow and mother to her two children. She, together with her children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mercedes operates a barbeque stall. She regularly buys pork, beef, and chicken entrails that she prepare for cooking and sells in the afternoon in her barbeque stand near her house. She also earns additional income by selling frozen meat products. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 800 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more products like beef, pork, chicken and frozen meat products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Mercedes dreams to be able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.ru: Мария проживает в городе Нурек. Ей 64 года. Она разведена. У нее трое детей. Мария имеет средне - специальное образование, парикмахер. Она арендует помещение, где открыта салон красоты. На сегодняшний день она работает парикмахером. В этой области работает уже двадцать лет. Кредит берет для приобретения необходимого оборудования и аксессуаров.
texts.en: Mariya lives in the city of Nurek.  She is 64 years old, divorced and has three children.  Mariya has a secondary-specialized education, as a hair stylist.  She leases a space, where she opened a beauty salon.  Today she works as a hair stylist.  She has been working in this field for twenty years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of necessary equipment and accessories.

loans.use: to purchase necessary equipment and accessories

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a resident of Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a widow, 59 years old. She has three grown children who sometimes help her in the business when not busy. 

She makes ice candy and other snack items to sell in the community and distributes them in some contact areas not too far from her place. Maria came up with this idea for a business venture five years ago.  She makes PHP 8,400 a month, approximately, doing this job.

To have access to financial services, Maria joined GDMPC in the year 2009. All her previous loans were successfully paid back. This year, she is again requesting a loan of PHP 35,000 from the cooperative to purchase highly-needed materials for making ice candy and other refreshments. She usually gets empty boxes or containers at the end of the day - sold out - that pushes her to go on.
 
With this additional investment made, Maria hopes to improve product quality and produce other salable products to sell to lift up the general living condition of the family.

loans.use: To purchase highly-needed materials for making ice candy and other refreshments.

loans.name: Cherry Group

texts.en:
Cherry is married with three children. Cherry is 36 years old and lives in Ramon Magsaysay.

Cherry sells  to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 2000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Cherry has been a member of PMPC for one year. Cherry is the leader of a three person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru:
Рустам занимается изготовлением кирпича дома. Он добросовестный и ответственный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Он изготавливает сырого кирпича, а затем продает их. Кроме этого он занимается скотоводством. Он покупает скота с других районов, а продает на местном рынке с надбавкой. Его жена  и сын иногда помогает ему.  Он запрашивает займ в размере 1000$ США для покупки материалов для производства кирпича и покупки скота. Он надеется, что кредиторы будут поддерживать его. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Rustam is involved in producing bricks.  He is a conscientious and responsible person.  He is a married and loving father of three children.  He makes raw bricks and then sells them.  Besides this, he is involved in animal husbandry.  He buys livestock from other districts and sells it at the local market with an added margin.  His wife and son sometimes help him with the business.  Rustam is requesting a loan in the sum of $1000 for the purchase of brick-making materials and to buy livestock.  He hopes that creditors will support him.

loans.use: to purchase materials for brick production and to purchase livestock

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is from Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 38 years old and married. She has three school-aged offspring to rear. Her husband is a good farmer. But not relying on the latter's income, Rosa engaged in a small-scale retailing activity. She is buying different sorts of raw and milled rice to sell profitably to the local community. She usually gets a total of PHP 20,000 a month from all income sources. She started on this three years ago and continues to the present time.

Rosa became a GDMPC member earlier this year. A loan of PHP 25,000 is requested to acquire several sacks of rice to sell retail. For Rosa, this is a good business to engage into because everyone is coerce to buy knowing that it is a basic commodity relevant in day to day survival.

Rosa plans to expand the business venture and work on additional farming to earn more income.

loans.use: To acquire several sacks of rice to sell retail.

loans.name: Julidie Group

texts.en:
Julidie is 32 years old and lives in Ramon Magsysay. She is married with four children. 

Julidie has a general store. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of 3000 PHP to purchase more dried fish for her retail business.

Julidie has been a member of PMPC for two years. Julidie is the leader of a 3-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for her retail business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 43 years, married and supporting three children. He has been operating a boutique selling different kinds of clothes for the past seven years with a monthly income of KES 5000.

He was introduced to KADET by a KADET staff member. This is his fourth loan which he has planned to use to increase his stock in dresses, shoes, sweaters, T-shirts, etc.

With the anticipated profit made he will build a permanent house. His dreams are to educate his children to higher levels.

loans.use: to increase his stock of dresses, shoes, sweaters, T-shirts, etc.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
This is Rosita, 43, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Redimundo, an employee, and mother to their five children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Rosita earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells breakfast meals in the morning like hotdogs and eggs with buns.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, beverages and other products to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rosita hopes to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and  draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 33 years old, is married with three children and lives in Tangub City. To earn a living, she makes and sells snacks. From this she earns about 3,000 PHP each month.

Julieta has been a member of PMPC for a year. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more ingredients to make her snacks.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to make her snacks.

location.town: Maloro, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson, 52 years old, is married and has seven children, two of whom are in school. For the past seventeen years he has practiced mixed farming, i.e., rearing sheep and goats as well as growing maize.

Wilson learned about KADET LTD through a KADET staff member. He is applying for a second KADET loan of 80,000 KES which he plans to use part of on his maize crop and the remaining portion to purchase more animals.

Wilson hopes to use all profits to educate his children. He dreams of expanding his farm.

loans.use: to use part of on his crops and part to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
Loise is 43 years old, married to Waweru and has three children.

Loise has been manufacturing and selling metal products for the last three years. She was introduced to KADET by one of her friends who is already a KADET client, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use a loan of 30,000 KES to buy more materials to use in her metal workshop.

In the future Loise hopes to grow her workshop and produce metal products on a large scale.

loans.use: to buy more materials to use in her metal workshop.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is married and blessed with four children. She is a diligent mother who has no other desire than to lift her family’s standard of living.

For over ten years Rosario has run her sari-sari store. She usually sells canned goods, bread, spices, drinks and cooking oil. While her earnings depend on the availability of products, she regularly earns more than 10,000 PHP a month.

Rosario wants to increase her earnings. She is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy additional products to sell in her village.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell in her village.

loans.name: Kien

texts.en:
Kien is a 42-year-old married woman with three children. They live in Ho Chi Minh.

For the past twenty years Kien and her husband have been operating a food stall selling noodles. She would like to take a loan of 15,000,000 VND to buy a greater variety and quantity of food to sell from her stall. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and increase the turnover in her business.

Kien hopes that through her loan she will be able to improve her family's living conditions and set aside savings for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of food to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
This is Jesus, 64 years old and a resident of Malibay, a section of Pasay City in the Philippines. He is married to Cristifa, an overseas contract worker and mother to their four children, all of whom have already married and have their own families. Jesus manages his household while operating his business. At this time he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses.

Jesus rents out nine rooms inside his apartment to local students and employees who rent on a monthly basis. He earns a minimum of 2,000 PHP per room rented.

To help him continue operations, Jesus is requesting a 27,000 PHP loan from CCT. He will be using the loan to repair and maintain his rental units. He expects a boost in his income as he expands his business. He hopes to finish his renovations soon.

All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups comprised of fifteen to thirty members that meet on a weekly basis. Jesus faithfully meets with his co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans. Jesus draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his rental units.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is married to a patient and hardworking farmer who is the father of their two children. They are both helping each other to sustain their family's needs. She describes herself as a small but loving wife and mother.

Eulalia manages her sari-sari store where she sells vinegar, soy sauce, catsup, noodles, coffee, sugar and bread. She also sells various snacks like pancakes and juice in their village’s school canteen.

According to Eulalia, through the income generated from her business she had been able to give weekly allowances to her children in school. She is happy now that her two children have graduated from college and are looking for work suitable to their degrees.

Eulalia wishes for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy San Mig Light beer and soft drinks to sell in her sari-sari store. Her goal is to repair her house which was damaged in the previous typhoon.

loans.use: to buy San Mig Light beer and soft drinks to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh is a 45-year-old married woman with two children. The family lives in Ho Chi Minh. For the past ten years she and her husband have earned a living running a general store.

Hanh would like to take a loan of 12,000,000 VND to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods including snack foods and confectionaries to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers.

Hanh hopes that because of the loan her business will yield a higher income. She hopes to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods to stock her general store.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
This is Gemma who is fifty years of age, has one child and is a resident of Pasay City in the Philippines. She is married to Maximo, a dental technician. Together with her husband and child, she manages the household while operating her business. She works hard to continually provide income for the family’s everyday expenses.

Gemma operates a sari-sari store. In the Philippines, a sari-sari store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five PHP’s-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She makes an income by buying supplies at wholesale prices and then selling them by the piece. She also sells burgers for snacks.

Gemma’s store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 750 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP CCT loan. She will be using it to buy groceries, beverages and other products to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she does so.

Gemma hopes to give her child a good and high-quality education through all of her hard work in her store.

All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups comprised of fifteen to thirty members that meet on a weekly basis. Gemma faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans. Gemma draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

loans.use: to buy groceries, beverages and other products to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Sasine

texts.en:
Sasine is aged 26, single, and supports his parents. He has been a wheat farmer for the past three years. He knew KADET through a registered client.  He is applying for his second loan which he plans to use to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers. 

With the anticipated profit made, Sasine will use to purchase sheep for fattening.  He dreams that at the age of thirty five he will have a stable family life.

loans.use: purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.ru: Гулдаста проживает в городе Нурек. Возраст, 21 год. Не замужем. Она предоставляет услугу, работает парикмахером в салоне красоты. В этой области она работает два года. Кредит берет для приобретения аксессуаров и покупки косметики.
texts.en: Guldasta lives in the city of Nurek.  She is 21 years old and single.  She provides a service and works as a hair stylist at a beauty salon.  She has been working in this field for two years.  Guldasta is requesting this loan for the purchase of accessories and cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase accessories and cosmetics

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Selling cosmetics and other beauty products such as lotion, shampoo, body wash etc. is what Marlyn does. She has been earning a monthly net income of 4600 for the last 5 years from this operation. Marlyn is 36 years old, has a live-in partner, and is blessed with 5 children. They are living together in the village of San Pedro, Dapitan.

In 2010, Marlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve both her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.   Marlyn is requesting her 3rd loan of 14,999 PHP, which will be used to purchase more perfume and beauty products. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: purchase perfume and beauty products to resell

location.town: San Pedro, Dapitan City, Zambo.Del Norte

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
Maria Teresa is 45 years old and lives in Austin Heights, Kolambugan, Lanao Del Norte.  She is married and has 3 children. 

To earn a living, Maria Teresa has a business selling cassava cakes. She earns about PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work. Maria Teresa has requested a loan to purchase another oven and ingeredients to be used for cassava making.

Maria Teresa has been a member of PMPC for 1 month.  In the future, she would like to improve her living condition and to make her business become successful.

loans.use: purchase an oven and ingredients to make cassava cakes

loans.name: Thang

texts.en:
