Thang is a 54-year-old married man living in Ho Chi Minh City. He has 2 sons. He and his wife earn a living running a general store, which they have done for 30 years. 

Thang would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods such as foods and beverages to stock his general store. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and increase the turnover for his business.   He also hopes that through this loan his business will generate a higher income and help him improve his family's living conditions and enable him to set aside some savings.

loans.use: increase his store inventory

loans.name: Mt Kipengere Group

texts.en:
Asha, who is in her early 40s, is married and has two children who are going to school.  She has been a food vendor for three years now.  She works from 6 a.m to 8 p.m daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Asha's 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her food stock and pay school fees and house expenses.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  

Asha hopes for another loan to buy 25 kilos of rice, 15 kilos of flour, 10 kilos of beans, 3 kilos of sugar and  cold drinks.  Her dream is to one day be able to start selling fabrics and sarongs.  She will share this loan with her loan group "Mt Kipengere", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy food items to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 28 years of age and is married. She is engaged in a retailing business in her village. She sells spices, breads, milk, diapers and cooking oil. She just started her business last year and is happy that her business still operates and is able to gain PHP 3,000 per month.

Lourdes believes that she can increase her profits if she can add more products to sell in her village.  She  is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy beauty products like perfumes, lotions and face powder to sell to her customers.  She will earn 25% of the capital she invests. She will use the profit to create a better way of living for her family.

loans.use: buy beauty products to sell

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is a 38-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has 2 children. Her husband works as a mechanic. Nga earns a living running a general store, which she has done for 10 years. 

Nga would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods such as snack foods and beverages to stock her general store. She hopes this will enabL. her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through this loan her business will generate a higher income and help her to improve her family's living conditions and enabL. her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods such as snack foods and beverages to stock her general store

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 34 years old and is a married man with 4 children. His oldest child is 10 years old.

Alex is a farmer who owns and tills a plot of land in Banga, South Cotabato. He primarily grows rice to sell. Alex works hard to support his family. Since his wife was not working, he decided to put up a sari-sari store that his wife can manage. He said that the store will help with their daily needs.

Alex has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. He hopes for their businesses to grow.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Baljinnyam

texts.en:
Baljinnyam is 48 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband is a security guard at the Mongolian State Culture Center and one of her children goes to college. She started her business in 1999 with her husband by selling flour, rice and sugar at Han-ord market. Currently, her husband is not involved in the family business. She is planning to increase her sales turnover. Her business profit is increasing gradually.  

Baljinnyam is a diligent woman who says, "I want to improve my business and increase sales volume."  She is requesting a 2,300,000 MNT loan to buy rice and sugar from the west border of Mongolia and flour from Bayan-Olgii province.

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is 54 years old and lives in Bañadero, Ozamiz City. She is married and has 3 children. 

To earn a living, Rosanna has a business selling Nata De Coco. She earns about PHP 8,000 each month doing this type of work. Rosanna has requested a loan to purchase ingredients to be used for making Nata De Coco.

Rosanna has been a member of PMPC for 1 month.  In the future, she would like to improve her living conditions and to make her business become successful.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make nata de coco

loans.name: Phu

texts.en:
Phu is a 44-year-old married man living in Ho Chi Minh City. He has two sons. His wife works collecting and selling recycled waste products. 
Phu is an electician and he earns a living by selling second-hand televisions and repairing broken televisions for customers in his community. He would like to take a loan to buy old or broken televisions in order to repair them to sell. He hopes that through this loan he will be able to increase the turnover of his business. This will enable him to increase his income, save for the education of his children and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy old or broken televisions to repair and sell.

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel is 29 years old and lives in Bañadero, Ozamiz City. She is married with two children. 
Ritchel has a mini grocery business and earns approximately 4,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase grocery stock for her store. 
Ritchel has been a member of Kiva partner, PMPC, for one year. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions and enlarge her store.

loans.use: to purchase grocery stock.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
This is Ivy, aged 61, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Fernando, a driver, and mother to their children. She, together with her husband and children, manages the household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
Ivy operates a computer rental shop. In the Philippines, very few people own their own computers. Therefore there is a need for computers, especially for students who need to do research and write papers. Ivy rents out computers by the hour and offers printing and typing services. Aside from this she also sells electronic cell phone loads. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. Ivy earns a minimum of 800 Philippine Pesos (PHP) every day.
To help Ivy continue to operate her business, she is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP. She will be using the loan to buy computer parts, software and electronic loads for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
Ivy hopes to add more computer units in her shop. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy computer spare parts and cell phone load products.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en: Hai is 58 years old and married with three children. The family lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Hai's husband earns money by raising pigs and chickens. Hai earns an income by running a general store in front of her house, selling a variety of goods and vegetables. She intends to use her loan to restock her store. She hopes her business will continue to run smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of goods and vegetables to stock her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy kerosene, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia, 55, is married with four children. The family lives in Tambulig. To earn a living, Virginia sells dried fish retail. She has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 5000. She has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase materials for her house. Virginia has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her house

loans.name: Koodoo

texts.en: Koodoo is 61 years old and lives alone in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province of Mongolia. Her children are living separately now. She has sold well water since 2004. The most profitable months are between May and October. Her daily income from her water well is between 10,000 MNT and 25,000 MNT. In addition to the water business, she also runs a car wash and tire repair service. The monthly income from these additional activities are between 50,000 MNT and 100,000 MNT. She is a diligent woman who says: "I want to increase the income from my water well by fixing the well. Since my children are living separately, I have less workload and have time to focus on my business." She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to fix the water well.

loans.use: To fix the water well

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a mother of a 10 year old and has been farming in her matrimonial home of Kitale which is located in Western Kenya.  She is 34 years old and her farm produces milk which she sells to Kenya Co-operative Creameries.  Her farm also produces eggs and poultry birds which go to the local market.

Florence has made a loan request of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, and this is her second loan request with them.  She says she will use the loan to buy more poultry chicks and expand her poultry unit so that it will house more birds.  This will build a good foundation for better business.  It will help her to have a continual cash flow for improved management of her businesses.

She laments the stiff competition and airborne diseases as these are the major challenges in farming, especially of poultry.

loans.use: To purchase poultry chicks and expand her poultry unit

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en: Felicidad, 58, is married with six children. She lives in La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. To earn a living, Felicidad has a junk metal shop. She has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns approximately 20000. She has requested a loan for 7,000 to purchase plastic, bottles, bronze, G.I sheeting, and bronze to sell. Felicidad has been a member of PMPC for over a year. In the future, Felicidad hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy plastics, bottles, G.I (metal) sheeting, and bronze to sell

location.town: La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Luan's Group

texts.en:
Luan was born in 1963. She lives in Kinh No village, Uy No Commune, Dong Anh district. She has three sons. Her husband is a builder.

Mrs. Luan sells clothes in the market. She has had this job for ten years. She has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). This is the first time she joined SEDA. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy more new clothes to resell. She is the group leader of 5-member group loan from SEDA.

About the other borrowers in her group:

Thuy is 20 years old. She has one child. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND for her small business.

Huong is 31 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy food for pigs.

Xo is 24 years old. She has one child. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND for her small business.

Thom is 27 years old. She has one child. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy food for chickens.

loans.use: to buy more new clothes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add stock of sugar, cooking fat, soap and maize flour

loans.name: Nayantai

texts.en:
Nayantai is 55 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt or tent) in Hovd province of Mongolia. His three children attend the local high school. His wife works as a waitress at the Sports Center.

He worked as a carpenter at the wood factory from 1977 to 1995. In 1995 he started to make wooden frames for Mongolian yurts privately. He produces Mongolian yurt's walls, roof poles, and doors. He is very experienced in his field. He is planning to make more wooden yurt frames as the demand for new yurts will increase because of the marriage and festival season in September. He is a diligent man who says, "My oldest son just got married and I want to make wooden yurt frames for my son."

He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more wood to make doors, cabers (poles) and walls.

loans.use: to purchase more wood

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a hardworking 31-year-old business man. He is married and blessed with four children. For the last five years, he has been running a beauty salon so as to make a living. He also uses his premises to operate a barber shop. In the next 5 years he wants to have a well-established salon in the town centre.

He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy dryers and a shaving machine. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for making finances easily to access.

loans.use: to buy dryers and shaving machine

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda, 50, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Obed, her business partner, and she is mother to her three children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Yolanda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil or an egg. Yolanda earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, beverages and other products to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Yolanda hopes to grow her business and give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: La

texts.en: La sells vegetables, meat and groceries and her husband is a farmer who also raises cows at home. They have four sons: one is a chef, one is a security guard, and the others are in school. The family lives in a village about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh City. La is asking for another loan to purchase one more motorbike for her son, who is a security guard, to drive to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to drive to work.

loans.name: Sokundy

texts.en:
Sokundy and her husband, Samny, both 28 years old (pictured together), live in a village along National Road Number Five, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have a young son. 

Sokundy is a garment worker and her husband is a fisherman and farmer. She is asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is 48 years old and married, with four children. He does dairy farming to earn a living for his family. He also operates a butchery to supplement his income. Patrick has retained his business for six years because of his hard work. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to improve his business with his loans. Now, he hopes to open more butcheries. Patrick has requested a loan of 80,000 KES to buy cows and goats for slaughter.

loans.use: To buy cows and goats for slaughter

loans.name: Kimsrieng

texts.en:
Kimsrieng is a garment worker and her husband, Sokny, is a rice farmer and fisherman. They have two children - one son and one daughter. The family lives along National Road Five, about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Kimsrieng is asking for a loan of $1,000 to build a restroom for family use and to purchase one more boat for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.use: to build a restroom for family use and to purchase one more boat for her husband’s fishing business

loans.name: Karume Group

texts.en:
Mariam, who is in her early 30s, is single with one child who attends school. She has been running a beauty salon for four years. She works from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Mariam's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy salon equipment which was out of stock and she has repaid her loan successfully. Mariam wants a loan to buy more salon equipment. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

Mariam will share this loan with her group "Karume" which consists of 20 members who will hold each other accountable for repaying their loans.

loans.use: To buy more salon equipment.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila, 54 years old, is married and has 9 children. She lives in San Isidro, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Leonila has a sari-sari (variety) store and sells snacks. She has had this business for 10 years, earning approximately PHP 2,000 monthly. Leonila has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase more stock for her grocery store. Leonila has been a member of PMPC for more than 1 year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store

location.town: San Isidro, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Chanvatey

texts.en:
Chanvatey, 25 years old, and her husband, Phearom, 26 years old, live along National Road Number Two, about twelve kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2007 and have a young daughter. 

Chanvatey is a garment worker. Her husband is a driver for a company. Chanvatey is asking for a loan of $700 to repair the house where she lives.

loans.use: To repair the house where she lives.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a resident and a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. He is married with one child, aged three. He has been farming for the past 12 years, producing and selling milk, vegetables and fruits.

Anthony has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This is his second loan request and he says it will make his business more productive since the first loan helped him learn a lot. He plans to use the income to expand the business by buying a better breed dairy cow.

Anthony mentions diseases and scarcity of animal feeds during dry seasons as the challenges in farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Odbayar

texts.en: Odbayar, 55 years old, lives with his wife and child in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province, Mongolia. He was a taxi driver from 2009 to 2011 in his local town. Since the spring of 2011, he has transported people and goods from Hovd province to Bulgan province. He also brings goods and supplies from the west side of Mongolia and goes to the countryside to exchange these goods and supplies for animal raw materials with nomadic herders. He then sells the collected raw materials at the local market. Odbayar is a diligent man who says, "I want to fix and improve my truck. I also plan to buy a commercial space at the local market so that my wife can sell goods and products." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy spare parts to fix his truck.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to repair his truck

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea, 61 years old, and his wife, Khom, 56 years old, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1969 and have seven children - three sons and four daughters. Six are married and one is a garment worker.  

Chea is a motor taxi driver and his wife stays at home and does housework. He is asking for a loan of $500 to build a fence around his house.

loans.use: To build a fence around his house.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
This is Editha, 53, and a resident of Malibay, Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Constantino, a driver. Editha, her husband and their children manage their own household while operating their business. Editha works hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Editha oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. They have two jeepney units that have a capacity of 18 people who pay a boundary (daily quota) each day. Editha’s husband also drives one of their jeepneys if their driver is not available. Their regular customers are students and employees in the local community. The business collects a minimum of PHP 1,800 in boundary every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, Editha is requesting a PHP 28,000 loan to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her jeepneys. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Editha dreams of acquiring another jeep or van. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

Footnote: Curiously, jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their jeepneys

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Saroeun, 47 years old, and her husband, Sophoan, 42 years old, live in a village along National Road Number One, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have one son and three daughters.  

Saroeun is hired by villagers to farm. She gets paid with fees, which she uses to support her family. Her husband is a tuk tuk (auto rickshaw) taxi driver. His motorbike is old and breaks often, and repairs cost him a lot of money. He finds it difficult to manage his income to support his family. Hence, Saroeun is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to replace the old one.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike for her husband

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy detergent and an iron

loans.name: Savoeurn

texts.en:
Savoeurn and her husband, Kong, are gardeners. They live in a village along National Road Number One about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have seven children - three sons and four daughters. Five are married and live outside the family home and two are gardeners along with their parents. Savoeurn is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. 

Savoeurn and her husband appear in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is 26 years old and single. He is a hardworking businessman. For the last 2 years, Eric has been running an electronics shop and a hardware store. He employs two people in his business. Over the next 5 years, Eric wants to have increased his product portfolio. His dream is to expand his business.

Eric is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a television. Thanks to Faulu Kenya he has been able to access finances to inject into his business.

loans.use: To buy a television

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 47 years old and lives in Blancia Molave Zamboanga del Sur. She is married and has 7 children. 

Elizabeth operates a barbeque stand, earning a monthly income of about PHP 3,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase pork and sauce ingredients for her barbecue business. In the future, Elizabeth hopes that she can earn more money from her business so that she can provide for her family's financial needs.

loans.use: to purchase pork and sauce ingredients for her barbecue business

loans.name: Anecito

texts.en:
63-year-old Anecito is a married man with seven children. He is a farmer who tills a piece of land in Banga, South Cotabato. He grows rice and corn and sells his harvest at the market. Anecito works hard to support his family. He also wants to be able to support his grandchildren through his business.

Anecito plans to use his loan to purchase four sacks of fertilizers, two quarts of insecticides and other farm inputs. He hopes for his business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase four sacks of fertilizers, two quarts of insecticides and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Furkatchon

texts.ru:
Фуркатчон умный, образованный и целеустремленный человек.  Он женат и ответственный отец 2 детей. Его жена занимается шитьем национальных платьев в местном районе. Фуркатчон занимается купля продажей скатов более 4 года. В настоящее время у него в активе имеется 4 скота на сумму 8000 Сомони. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получит максимальный прибыль с целью улучшение условие свой семейной жизни. Фуркатчон хотел бы получит займ на сумму 1000$ США для покупки скота. Он заранее благодарен всем за поддержку и доброты. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Furkatchon is a smart, educated and goal-oriented person.  He is a married and responsible father of two children.  His wife is involved in sewing national dresses at the local district.  Furkatchon is involved in buying and selling livestock for over four years.  He currently has four heads of livestock, valued at 8000 Somoni.  He wants to expand his business and obtain a maximum profit in order to improve his family's conditions.  Furkatchon wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1000 for the purchase of livestock.  He is thankful in advance to all for the support and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 37 years old and lives in Ibabao, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is a widow with two children.

Rowena has a shop that sells dry goods. She has had  this business for six  years. She requested a loan of 50,000 to purchase dry goods for her business.         

Rowena has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, Rowena hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as dry goods for her general store.

loans.name: Paradise Group

texts.en:
Richard, who is in his early 20s, is single. He takes care of his younger sister and younger brother who go to school.  He has been running a clothing shop since 2006.  He works from 8 a.m to 10 p.m daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which he wants to use to buy more clothes for his shop. His dream is to one day be able to go for further studies. He is a primary seven leaver, so he wants to go for secondary education.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Paradise" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for his shop.

loans.name: Ma.martina

texts.en:
This is Martina, 49, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Alberto, a driver, and mother to their two children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Martina operates a computer rental shop. In the Philippines, very few people own their own computers. Thus there is a need for rental computers, especially for students who need to do their research and papers. Martina rents out computers by the hour and offers printing and typing services. Aside from this she also operates a small retail store. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 800 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her computer units. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Martina hopes to add more computer units to her shop and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her computers.

loans.name: Eudosia

texts.en:
Eudosia is sixty-three years old. She is married and she lives in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She has two children. Eudosia has a small sari-sari (variety) store. She has been doing this job since she got married. She requested a loan of 40,000 to purchase materials for the renovation of their house.

Eudosia has been a member of PMPC for more than one year.

loans.use: To purchase for the materials for house construction.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is married and has two children, one of whom attends school.  Marites' husband is in the Philippine Army; they spend time together when his superior grants him vacation time.

Marites manages their rice farming business. As an extra source of income, she is an AVON dealer. She sells cosmetics and fragrances such as  perfume, lotion, lipstick, and face powder in their village.

Marites is requesting a loan for 20,000 PHP to purchase  shampoo, roll-ons, and conditioner to sell in their village. She will use the loan to expand the products she offers to her costumers.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, roll-ons, and conditioner.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 43 years old and lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City. She is married with 2 children.

Mercy has a business selling items such as soft drinks, canned goods, rice and corn. She earns about PHP 5,000 each month. Mercy has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to buy more stock. Mercy has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Mercy would like to have a big store in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 200kg of potatoes for sowing,100 liters of water and 6kg of fertilizer, and to pay for labor

loans.name: 3.9.72 Thiệu Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Huệ operates a food stall selling processed food. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make processed food to sell.

Huệ is 33 years old and she is married with two children. Huệ  is the group leader of the 3.9.72 Thiệu Hóa  solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with her two dependents.

This is Huệ's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Huệ  has been involved in this business for three years. The main hardship that Huệ faces in her business is not being able to meet the high demand for products.

In future, Huệ  hopes to buy land of her own, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make processed food to sell.

loans.name: Yawavi

texts.fr:
Yawavi est une femme âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée å un douanier à la retraite. Elle a 03 enfants.
Yawavi travaille comme revendeuse de sacs de charbons et des céréales il ya 03 ans. Elle vend à domicile et achète à ANIE. 
Yawavi a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter 12 sacs de charbon et 04 sacs de maïs.
texts.en:
Yawavi is a 36-year-old woman who is married to a retired customs agent. She has three children. She has been working as a retailer of charcoal and grains for three years. She sells out of her home and makes her purchases in ANIE.

Yawavi has requested her second loan at WAGES in order to buy 12 sacks of charcoal and 4 sacks of corn.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and grains

loans.name: Olimchon

texts.ru:
Олимчон честный, добросовестный и трудолюбивый муж. У него 2 детей и он хочет вырасти их в хороших условиях жизни. Он очень старается, чтобы его дети учились в хороших школах города. Он занимается услугами таксиста более 4 года. Олимчон хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свой прибыль. Ему необходимо отремонтировать свою автомашину, с этой целью Олимчон запрашивает займ в размере 1000$ США. Он хочет заранее благодарит Кива и Кива кредиторы за поддержку и милосердие. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Olimchon is an honest, conscientious and hard-working husband.  He has two children, and he wants to raise them in good conditions.  He tried hard to make sure that his children attend good schools in the city.  He is involved in providing taxi service for over four years.  Olimchon wants to expand his business and maximize his profits.  He needs to repair his car, and this is why Olimchon is requesting a loan in the sum of $1000.  He wants to thank Kiva and Kiva creditors in advance for the support and mercy.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
This is Arlene, 41, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Rolando, her business partner, and mother to their five children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Arlene operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She also retails rice grains per kilo. Arlene earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She makes a minimum of 2000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and rice to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Arlene hopes her business will grow into a mini-grocery and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: 3.9.73 Thiệu Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Điệp operates a food stall selling fruit. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.

Điệp  is 37 years old and she is married with one child. Điệp is the group leader of the 3.9.72 Thiệu Hóa  solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with her one dependent.

This is Điệp's  first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Điệp  has been involved in this business for four years. The main hardship that Điệp faces in her business is not being able to meet the high demand for products.

With her business profit, Điệp hopes to remodel her house and to maintain her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: Milyn

texts.en:
Milyn is married with three children. Milyn is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Milynl is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase lumber for her house repair. 

She has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Milyn hopes to be successful in her chosen business.

loans.use: to purchase lumber for her house repair.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Abla est une femme âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée å un retraité. Elle a 03 enfants.
Abla travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2007. Elle vend à domicile.  Elle achète les produits à Lomé et au marché d’AGOE. 
Abla a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter du sucre, du riz, de l’huile et des cartes de recharges.
texts.en:
Abla is a 41-year-old woman who is married to a retiree. She has three children. 

Abla has been working as a grocer since 2007. She sells out of her home. Her gets her supplies from Lomé, the capital of Togo, and from the AGOE market. 

Abla has requested her first loan from the micro-finance institution WAGES in order to buy sugar, rice, oil, and some recharge cards.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and mobile phone recharge cards

loans.name: 74 Thiệu Đô Group

texts.en:
Mrs Liên has a business selling mobile phones. She is requesting a loan to purchase mobile phones to resell.

Liên is 38 years old and she is married with 2 children. Liên is the group leader of the 74 Thiệu Đô solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.

This is Liên's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Liên has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that Liên faces in her business is the lack of transportation. With her business profit, Liên hopes to buy land of her own, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones to resell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 26 years old, married and blessed with an eight-month-old child.  He runs a land bureau business to earn a living.  He also distributes cakes to earn extra income.  He was previously employed before he went into business.  Through Faulu Kenya, he was also able to get capital to start a farming business.

Joseph hopes to grow his businesses and employ people.  He has requested 60,000 Kenya shillings to start a motorbike transport business.

loans.use: To start a motorbike transport business.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita is married and has 7 children. She is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Melita is a farmer who has raised pigs for 3 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase piglets and feed. Melita has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Melita hopes to be successful in her chosen business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chicks

loans.name: Kimberly

texts.en:
Kimberly is 20 years old and married, with one infant. For the past five years, she has been running a small business where she sells cosmetics, beauty products and even personal items such as bags and clothes to all types of customers in her community. Kimberly describes herself as obedient.

Kimberly is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase additional cosmetic and beauty products. Kimberly hopes that someday she can renovate their house to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, beauty products, bags and clothes to sell

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Ever since Marcelina, 39 years old, was very little, she really liked the art of welding. That is why she thought of having her own business making gates and windows. Her husband and daughter help her with the business, specifically with customer relations. That is why Marcelina does her work with great enthusiasm and dedication. 

In order to continue with her business, Marcelina wants a loan to buy hoses and a welding machine for her welding shop. Her big dream is to have a well-established business and a good quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy hoses and a welding machine

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
This is Lourdes, 61. She is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. A widow, she manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Lourdes operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5-pesos worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (Php) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php40,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Lourdes hopes her business grows in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a hard-working 53-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with 28-year-old twins. To make a living, she has been operating a grocery shop. Her goal, in the next 5 years, is to have established other retail outlets selling fresh groceries. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES to buy bananas, paw paws, mangoes, kale and onions. Thanks to Faulu Kenya she is now able to manage her business more effectively.

loans.use: to buy bananas, paw paws, mangoes, kale and onions

loans.name: Bahriniso

texts.ru: Бахринисо проживает в городе Нурек. Ей 49 лет. Она разведена. У нее четверо детей. Бахринисо имеет среднее образование. Она занимается шитьем. Берет заказы на дому. Она в основном шьет национальные платья и пастельное белье. Этим видом деятельности занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для приобретения новой швейной машинки.
texts.en: Bahriniso lives in the city of Nurek.  She is 49 years old, divorced and has four children.  Bahriniso has a secondary education.  She is involved in sewing and completes her work orders at home.  She primarily sews national dresses and bedding.  She has been involved in this business for five years.  Bahriniso is requesting this loan for the purchase of a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Conrado

texts.en:
Conrado is 39 years old and is a married man with 4 children ages 16, 14, 9 and 5. He earns a living through farming. Conrado spends his whole day working at the farm. He cultivates his land for planting corn and rice crops. Conrado sells his harvest to rice traders in his town.

Conrado has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Conrado hopes to have a happy and healthy family. He also hopes for his business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a dedicated 28-year-old businessman. He is single. For the last 10 years, he has been operating a barber shop so as to make a living. Previously, he used to sell various assorted merchandise. He wants, in the next 5 years, to be a well-known entrepreneur and his dream is to be an influential businessman. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES to buy two shaving machines and open another barber shop. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now self-reliant.

loans.use: To buy two shaving machines and open another barber shop

loans.name: Esnarda

texts.en:
This is Esnarda, 64, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. A widow, she manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Esnarda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this, she is also selling home-cooked meals to her neighbors and retails herbal/organic products. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 40,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Esnarda hopes her business grows in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
Hani is a 43-year-old hard-working man, who is supporting a family of five by selling frozen meat, chicken and fish. He even has special equipment in his shop for cutting meat based on the customer's desire (small pieces, steaks, chopped meat).

Hani has applied for this loan in order to expand his shop by renting the next door shop and buying more equipment and making a special section for barbequing as a new service to be added.

loans.use: To expand his shop by renting the next door shop and buying more equipment and making a special section for barbequing.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a hardworking and active 29-year-old business lady.  She is married and blessed with two children, one of whom is in school. Since the year 2010, she has been rearing poultry to make a living. Previously, she used to work as a beauty specialist. 

In the next five years, she wants to have a large number of chickens and to be a distributor of eggs. Her dream is to rear livestock in the future. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy chickens.

loans.use: To buy more broiler chickens and layers.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema lives in Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (a sister and her children). Rehema has a food stall. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Rehema sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

Rehema has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to more bunches of bananas, cassava and Irish potatoes. The main business challenges for Rehema include seasonality, thieves and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on a wholesale basis only and also to start going to villages for foodstuffs. 

Rehema lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, cassava and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Elnie

texts.en:
Elnie is married with two children. She is 38 years old and lives in Magsaysay St. Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She earns from her farm to support their living. She has been doing this since she got married. She requested a loan for 10,0000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase farm inputs and fertilizers.

In the future, she hopes that she can earn more from her farm so that she can provide for the needs of her two children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizers.

loans.name: Solichon

texts.ru:
Соличон трудолюбивый и добросовестный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Более 12 лет Соличон занимается купля продажей скота и мясо. Он покупает скота и продает, откармливая их в течение 20-30 дней. Он продаёт мясо на центральном рынке города и имеет свою собственную торговую точку. Соличон старается, содержит свою семью в хороших условиях жизни и обучит своих детей в хороших школах и университетах. Он хотел бы получит займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки скота. Соличон заранее благодарен всем за поддержку и поощрение.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Solichon is a hard-working and conscientious person.  He is a married and loving father of three children.  Solichon has been involved in buying and selling livestock and meat for over twelve years.  He buys livestock and sells it, after fattening it up for 20-30 days.  He sells meat at the central city market and has his own retail outlet.  Solichon tries hard to provide good living conditions for this family and wants his children to attend good schools and universities.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of livestock.  Solichon thanks everyone in advance for the help and support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Chunt

texts.en:
Chunt is 46 years old and lives with her four children and husband in a house in the Govisumber province of Mongolia. Her eldest child is living separately and her other three children attend the local high school. Her husband is currently unemployed, but during the spring he combs the hair of cashmere goats. The price to comb a goat is between 1,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) and 1,500 MNT. 

Chunt started her business five years ago by selling steamed dumplings, cooked meat and water at the local train station. Her children help her to run the business. She is planning to expand her business activity and increase her income. In the meantime, she is a loyal customer of our bank. 

She is requesting 400,000 MNT to buy more products to expand her business activity.

loans.use: To buy more product to expand her business of selling steamed dumplings, cooked meat and water.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin is a determined 21-year-old businessman. He is single. For the last three years, he has been distributing soft drinks to make a living. In the next five years, he wants to have diversified his investment to at least three other different sectors. His dream is to own a large firm.

 He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy sodas and water. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now financially literate.

loans.use: To buy sodas and water.

loans.name: Germaine

texts.fr:
Jeune femme de 39ans d’âge, célibataire et mère de  4 enfants  dont l’âge varie entre 10 et 26 ans est devenue vendeuse de poison salé au marché a l’arrêt de ses études secondaires.
Son expérience pour les 3 crédits  passés lui a permis de prendre  conscience de ce qui concerne les épargnes, elle a des recettes de 50.000 a 100.000F par jour.
 Elle  rentre dans le cycle 4 et va  bénéficié d’un prêt plus important, pour cela elle va acheter 10 cartons de poisson salé importé (thon, morue, soles, requin, cancre)  et  5 cartons de poisson de mer bars a Pointe Noire  qu'elle va pour séché le poisson sur place. 
 Entreprenante,  souriante et accueillante, elle a une seule ambition, celle d’avoir une baraque de vente de poisson salé en gros.
C’est une mère responsable et très célèbre auprès de ses clients au marche
texts.en:
This client is a young 39-year-old woman. She is a single mother with 4 children aged between 10 and 26 who became a market trader of salted fish when her high school studies ended.
Thanks to the experience gained during her 3 previous loans, she has learned how to manage her savings. Her daily revenues are between 50,000 and 100,000XAF.
She is now in her 4th loan cycle and will benefit from a larger loan that will enable her to buy 10 boxes of imported salted fish (tuna, cod, sole, shark and crab) and 5 boxes of sea bass from the coastal town of Pointe Noire so that she can dry fish at home.
An enterprising, cheerful and welcoming individual, she has only one ambition: to have a stall where she can sell salted fish wholesale.
She is a responsible mother who is very well-known among her customers at the market.

loans.use: To buy boxes of salted fish: Tuna, sole, cod, shark and crab

loans.name: Kahoru

texts.en:
Kahoru has operated in the transport industry in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last three years. He is 27 years old and married to Leah. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy a new motorcycle. He will employ someone else to operate it while he operates his old one. 

In the future, Kahoru hopes to buy a pickup truck, which he will be using to transport goods to and from the market

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Falasteen

texts.en:
Falasteen is a 42-year-old woman, who is helping her husband in his business selling bottled water. They have a contract with one of the small factories that filters water to distribute drinking water bottles in the areas that cannot be reached.

Being in the business for six years has given them a trusted reputation. Now Falasteen has applied for a loan to buy more bottled water at a good price to be able to cover and serve more people in the area.

loans.use: to buy more bottled water at a good price to serve more people in the area.

loans.name: Innoncent

texts.fr:
Innocent  est né au Rwanda et a 32 ans. Il est célibataire .Son niveau d’éducation est 4 ans des études secondaire. Innocent est salarie. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour renouveler sa maison d’habitation.  
Son stratégie pour la croissance de son business est renouveler sa maison avec des matériels forte envie d’augmenter sa valeur. Dans les prochaines années, Innocent voudrait continuer ses études pour mieux prépare l’avenir   et fonder une famille.
texts.en:
Innocent was born in Rwanda and is 32 years old. He is single. His educational level is four years of secondary school. Innocent is an employee. This is his first loan with ACB. He will use this loan to renovate the house he lives on.

His business strategy is to renovate his house using sturdy materials as to increase the house’s value. In the future, Innocent would like to continue his study in order to assure a better future and be able to start a family.

loans.use: to renovate his house

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years. She is 27 years old and married to Simon; they have two school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers, and this will be her second loan. She paid her previous loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow to boost her farming income.

In the future, Hellen hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is married with 3 children.  Elsie is 36 years old and lives in Banigan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Elsie sells RTW's to earn a living and has had this business for 2 years.  Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan for 6,000 PHP to purchase more RTW's (ready to wear) clothing to retail.

Elsie has been a member of PMPC for over 1 year.  In the future, Elsie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more RTW's clothing to retail

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy has been in mixed farming in Kitale, Western Kenya, for the last 5 years. He produces milk and maize, which he sells at the local market. He is married with 4 children, 3 of whom are already in school.

Timothy has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase more birds for his poultry business. He hopes the business will make his life much better and enable him to venture into the motorcycle-transport business.

Timothy notes that diseases and low feeds during the dry season are the impediments to farmers in the area.

loans.use: to purchase birds for his poultry business

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en:
Milkah has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years.  She is 33 years old and a single mother of three school going children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her second loan.  She paid her previous loan of Kshs 10,000 well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Milkah hopes to become one of the leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 51 years old and is married with two children between the ages of 16 and 21 years old.  His business is well organized and he opens daily from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m.  Jean has 21 years of experience.

Jean has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more goods such as: soap, biscuits etc to sell.  With the expected profits, he plans to reinvest in his business and to save for his future.

loans.use: To purchase more goods such as: soap, biscuits etc to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
This is Elena, 56, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines.  A widow with three children with two are already working while the youngest is still in college. She, together with her children manage their own household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Elena operates a variety store.  In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood.  It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg.  She earns her income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.  Her store is located adjacent to her house.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan.  She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.  She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Elena hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Naranchimeg

texts.en:
Naranchimeg is 48 years old and lives with her daugther in an apartment in the city of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia.  Her daughter is a college student.  Her husband was desceased not long ago.  

She started her business in 2000 by selling foods at the Narantuul market.  Currently, she is an authoized distributor of NaranFoods LLC.  Her business is her main income source.  She has gained much business experience in her field.  She is a hard-working and open-minded woman who says "I want to expand my business activity."  She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more grocery products and to increase her capital turnover and business activity.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a businesswoman who runs a boutique to earn a living. She started operating her business in 1997 and has been able to expand her business with her previous loan from Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya.  She has also learned how to save her money.
Elizabeth hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future. She has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy trousers and shirts.

loans.use: to buy trousers and shirts.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel has operated his retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last four years. He also uses his motorbike for transport in Ndunyu Njeru, especially for transporting his goods to his retail shop. He is 28 years old, married to Sarah, and has one child.
Daniel was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET,  by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more goods such as soap, salt and sugar for sale in his retail shop.
In the future, Daniel hopes to grow his retail shop to wholesale.

loans.use: to buy more goods such as soap, salt and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Majed

texts.en:
Majed is a 46-year-old married man who studied heating and cooling engineering. After getting his certificate, he worked in many places to gain experience in the field, until one day he opened his own store selling air conditioners and heaters plus providing the service of a heating and cooling technician.

After running his business for six years now in Al Mafraq, Majed has applied for a loan to buy more types and new models of air conditioners that are being requested by his customers.

loans.use: To buy more types and new models of air conditioners.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a determined 29-year-old businesswoman. She is married and blessed with a four-year-old child who attends school. For the last three years she has been selling household items in order to provide for her family. Previously, she was employed in a beauty salon. 
Grace wants to increase her product portfolio in the next five years. Her dream is to be financially stable. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy basins, cups and plastic jugs. Thanks to Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, she is now able to use her finances wisely.

loans.use: to buy basins, cups and plastic jugs.

loans.name: Percy

texts.en:
Percy  is member of PMPC living in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married and has two kids. Her children are already working. 

Aside from work she is also engaged in a small-scale retail business. She's been doing this business for more than 20 years and has earnings of 6,000 PHP a month for this business alone.

 Percy has requested a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase more beauty products for her cosmetics business. She has been a member of the co-op for almost four years.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty products for her cosmetic sales.

loans.name: Sambalhundev

texts.en:
Sambalhundev is 63 years old and lives with her husband in a four-room apartment in Govisumber province of Mongolia. All five of her children are living separately. Her husband works as a controlling engineer at a construction agency. 

Sambalhundev started her business activity about one year ago. She operates a clothes trading business. She expanded her commercial space at the local market. Currently she has goods and materials that are worth 1,000,000 MNT. She is planning to have many commercial counters at the market. She takes loans from our bank and asks for discounts regularly. She is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes and to expand her business activity.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 13 years.  He is 43 years old, married to Fresiah and they have two school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Peter hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Precilla

texts.en:
Prescila is 48 years old,  with three children. She started to worked since her husband left, and she took over all the responsibility for her three children. 

She has been running her hog raising business for three years. She hopes that she will be able to raise all the new born piglets she has. So she requested this loan amounting to P10,000 to purchase three sacks of feed for her hog-raising business. She also plans to change the wood division of her piggery into concrete. She hopes that she can increase her profit so that her plan will be fulfilled.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of feed for hog raising business.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 29 years old and married with three school-going children. 

He has a shoe selling business that he has been running for three years. He has been loaned KES 30,000 to enable him to buy more shoes to add to his stock. The anticipated profits made will enable him to pay school fees for his children.

He hopes to open up a wholesale shop for shoes in the future.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to add to his stock.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
Marie est née au Rwanda et a 57 ans. Elle est veuve et elle a 4 enfants de 16 à 28 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire. 
Marie est agricultrice de manioc, d’haricots et de sorghos. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit pour acheter des fertilisants pour l’agriculture de manioc. . 
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d‘utiliser les anglais chimiques et cultiver de façon moderne. Dans les prochaines années, Marie voudrait se développer elle même et contribuer au développement de la région où elle habite. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Marie is born on Rwanda and is 57 year old. She is a widow, with four children ranging from 16 to 28 years of age, and all four of them study. He educational level is six  years of primary school.

Marie grows manioc [cassava], beans and sorghum. This is her second loan cycle with ACB. She will use her loan to buy fertilizers to grow manioc. Her business strategy is to use chemical fertilizers and farm the modern way. In the future, she would like to grow her business and contribute to the development of the region she lives in. With her revenues, she plans to pay the tuition of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for growing manioc

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, 58 years old, is married and has been blessed with four children. He used to be a driver of a hand tractor but nowadays he chose to be a farmer. He has his own fields where he grows rice. Once it’s harvested he sells it in the market in order to obtain a higher income and be able to cover his household expenses. He is a father who is concerned about his family because at his age, he is still cultivating rice fields to sustain the needs of his family. He would like to expand his rice fields through cultivating the areas which are not yet cultivated. 

George is asking for additional capital amounting to P40,000 to buy fertilizer and insecticides to improve his land’s productivity. He hopes that he can improve his rice fields to be able to have good produce and increase his yields.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides for rice farming business.

loans.name: Ban

texts.en:
Ban is a 63-year-old married woman with 11 children, 8 sons and 3 daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

To earn an income to support their family for the past 20 years, Ban and her husband have run a coffee shop in front of their house. From their shop they sell coffee, cigarettes and sugarcane juice.

Ban would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing a greater quantity and range of coffee, cigarettes and beverages to sell from her shop. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a greater range and quantity of coffee, cigarettes and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive is 27 years old and is married with one child who is two years old. She sells various goods such as: cassava flour, cooking oil, sugar, rice, fruit and vegetables and so. Her business is well-organized. The hours of her business are from 8am until 5pm every day except on Saturday. She has three years' experience in this business and she currently employs one person to help her. 

Olive has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more beans, cassava flour, cooking oil, sugar, rice, fruit and vegetables and so for sale. With any profits, Olive will reinvest in her business, save for her future and she will be able to renovate her house.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava flour, cooking oil, sugar, rice and so on to sell.

loans.name: Enhtsetseg

texts.en:
Enhtsetseg is 49 years old and lives with her son in her apartment in the city of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her son attends a high school. She started to sell suits at the Dejiin Myanga market back in 1996. In 2002 she moved her business to the Narantuul market. Her business income is the sole income source for her family. She also has collected much business experience. Her total capital turnover is 4,000,000 MNT and her daily income is between 100,000 MNT to 200,000 MNT. 

Enhtsetseg is planning to expand her business activity. She is a diligent and hard-working woman who is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to buy more suits and to increase her capital turnover.

loans.use: To buy more suits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock of sugar, rice and maize flour in his retail shop.

loans.name: Abdilgozi

texts.ru: Абдилгози проживает в районе Яван. Ему 56 лет. Он женат, имеет семерых детей. Образование у него среднее. Он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. В этой области он уже более двадцати лет. Кредит берет для закупа коровы. Абдилгози хочет увеличить количество скота.
texts.en: Abdilgozi lives in the Yavan district.  He is 56 years old, married and has seven children.  He has a secondary education.  He earns his living by breeding cattle.  He has been in this business for over twenty years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of a cow.  Abdilgozi wants to increase his livestock quantity.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru:
Гулчехра честная, добросовестная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать 3 детей. Она занимается производством сыра. Этот бизнес ей предложила её подруга из Узбекистана, она прослушивалась ей и успешно продолжает до сегодняшнего дня. Каждый день он покупает около 500 литров молока, и производят 100 кг сыра. Её муж помогает ей в данном бизнесе. Она очень старается, чтобы её дети учились в хороших престижных школах.  Гулчехра запрашивает займ в размере 2400$ США для покупки оборудование и молока. Она хочет заранее благодарит Кива и Кива кредиторы за поддержку и милосердие. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.
