While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Gulchehra is an honest and hard-working woman.  She is a married and loving mother of three children.  She is involved in cheese production.  Her friend from Uzbekistan suggested this business to her, Gulchehra listened and successfully continues to run this business today.  She buys about 500 liters of milk every day and produces 100 kilograms of cheese.  Her husband helps her with this business.  She tries very hard to make sure that her children attend good, prestigious schools.  Gulchehra is requesting a loan in the sum of $2400 for the purchase of equipment and milk.  She wants to thank Kiva and Kiva creditors in advance for the support and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and milk

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 25 years old. She describes herself as a hardworking lady. She is married and blessed with three children who are school-going. For the last year, she has been operating a food stall so as to make a living. Previously, she used to sell porridge. 

In the next 5 years, she wants to be operating a successful business. Her dream is to own a restaurant. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy potatoes, cooking fat, tomato sauce and salt. Thanks to Faulu Kenya she is now able to access credit.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, cooking fat, tomato sauce and salt.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a hardworking 24-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with a one-year-old child. For the last year, he has been operating a retail shop so as to meet the needs of his family. He wants in the next 5 years to have upgraded his shop into wholesale. His dream is to own a piece of land and develop it. 

He is requesting a loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings to buy a bag of rice, sugar, maize and wheat flour. Thanks to Faulu Kenya he is now financially literate.

loans.use: To buy a bag of rice, sugar, maize and wheat flour.

loans.name: Sainbayar

texts.en:
Sainbayar is 51 years old and lives with her son and husband in a house in the city of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband is in disability pension and stays at home. Her son is an assistant to chief at the CIS Mongolia LLC. His monthly income is 293,558 MNT. 

Sainbayar started her business in 1995 by selling meat at the Huchit Shonhor market. From 2010, she has been continuing her business at the Narantuul-2 market. She has collected much business experience and made a constant client base. Her business turnover volume is 1,000,000 MNT and her daily income is about 150,000 MNT. 

She purchases meat from countryside herders at 5:00 AM in the morning and makes the by-products and sells the products to retailers. By 13:00 she finishes selling the by-products. Her family supports the business activity very much. She is planning to expand her business activity.

She is a hard-working and diligent woman who says "I want to buy a used small truck to transport products. I am spending sufficient amount of money on taxi expense. It would be nice to have a car, pay the loan interest and own the car." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a new car for her business to transport the meat.

loans.use: To purchase a new car to transport meat.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia  lives in  Uganda.  She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school.  Sofia has a retail shop.  She has been in this business for 8 months, and she works 7 days out of every week.  Sofia sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Sofia has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, and boxes of soap. 

The main business challenges for Sofia include seasonality and transportation and ever increasing prices.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop. Sofia lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt,  and  boxes  of soap.

loans.name: Kasparina

texts.en:
Kasparina is a 47-year-old woman who is married to Deny, 53 years old. They have five children, they are:

1. Desri, 27 years old
2. Noviana, 22 years old
3. Toni, 19 years old, who is recently graduated from senior high school;
4. Dewi, 15 years old, who is in the first grade of senior high school and
5. Lora, 13 years old, who is in the first grade of junior high school.

Kasparina and her husband own a plot of land where they grow vegetables and maize regularly, but the income from selling vegetables is only enough to meet their family's daily needs. Therefore, Kasparina tried to sell bananas to generate more income. She purchases bananas from other farmers in different markets and she resells the bananas in a traditional market. She has been running this business for almost three years.

Kasparina plans to expand her business by purchasing more bananas to sell. She also plans to buy piglets to rise. To do so, Kasparina is requesting a loan of IDR 7,500,000 from TLM. She believes the capital can really support her in developing her business as well as to the improvement of her finances in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bananas to sell and to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Semi

texts.en:
Semi is a 23-year-old single lady who lives with her parents in a modest house. To support her family, Semi sells tamarinds, candle nuts, and nutmeg or other goods such as copra that she purchases from other people. She has been running this business for almost three years. She sells her products from house-to-house as well as at the market. 

Semi usually spends the income from her business to buy her business stock and cover daily needs as well as to meet the educational costs of her siblings who are still at the high school. She admits that the income generated is not enough to fully cover her family's needs.

She is looking for ways to increase her income. She wants to purchase more crops, i.e. tamarinds, candle nuts, nutmeg and copra to sell. She is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 5,000,000 from TLM. She is quite sure that the loan will help her in improving her business.

loans.use: to buy tamarinds, candle nuts, nutmeg and copra to sell.

loans.name: Antiras

texts.en:
Antiras is a 27-year-old man who is married to Yuniarti. They have a daughter who is aged one year. Antiras runs a kiosk business to meet his family needs. He has been running this business for one year using his own capital. The kiosk is the only income source for his family and therefore he wants to see his business grow well. He usually utilizes the income from his business to replace the empty stock as well as to cover his family needs on a daily basis.

In his village there have not been many kiosks and this is absolutely an opportunity for Antiras to expand his kiosk business. Antiras wants to buy rice, stationery, kerosene, cooking oil and other items for his kiosk. He also plans to raise piglets. Therefore he is requesting a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from TLM. He hopes that his loan application will be approved.

loans.use: to buy rice, stationery, kerosene, cooking oil, etc. to sell and to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Alinyikira Womens Association Mutundwe Group

texts.en:
40-year-old Resty has been plying her poultry business for the past 10 years. The happily married mother of five says she began this business out of her her own enterprise. The lucrative business nature and high demand for chicken in Kampala, where she operates from is what precipitated her decision to join.

She says influence from close family and friends also contributed to her decision. Prior to that, she was involved in mostly odd jobs in and around Kampala, principally working in the decoration business.

Weekly she says this business generates gross sales revenue to the tune of Uganda shillings 50,000. Her optimism is high however. She says with this Kiva loan, her business prospects will get that improved lease on life that she has invariably wanted.

She plans to use her loan to purchase chicken mash and more chickens to resell

loans.use: to purchase chicken mash and more chickens to resell.

loans.name: Yeni

texts.en:
Yeni is a 34-year-old widow. She only has one son namely Dayat, 7 years old, who is studying in the fist grade of elementary school. 

Yeni runs a kiosk business by renting a small room nearby her house. She sells candies, biscuits, snacks, instant noodles, detergent, soap, shampoo, cereals, milk and beverages at her kiosk. She has been engaged in this business for seven years. 

Yeni wishes to improve her business by selling petrol and mobile phone recharges and adding more stock such as rice, sugar, coffee, cooking oil, etc. at her kiosk.  To do so, she is requesting a loan of IDR 3,000,000. She hopes that TLM will assist her in making her dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, coffee, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila  lives in  Uganda.  She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her in-laws). 

Jamila has a food stall.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Jamila sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Jamila has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas and sweet and Irish potatoes. 

The main business challenges for  Jamila include seasonality, thieves and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and also to start going to villages for foodstuffs.    Jamila lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs like bunches of bananas and sweet and  Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh is a 34-year-old married woman with three sons. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Anh earns an income to support her family by running a noodle stall in front of her house. She has been running her noodle business for the past four years.

Anh would like to receive a L. to repair her food stall and buy more food to sell. She hopes that this will enable her to earn a higher income, improve her family's living conditions, and set aside some savings for the education of her children.

loans.use: to repair her food stall and buy more food to sell

loans.name: Fifana Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FIFANA est composé de trois personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier au Bénin. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Pascaline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Pascaline est âgée de 40 ans et est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Martial. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Pascaline mène comme activité depuis quinze ans la vente de boissons. A côté de cette activité qui lui génère des revenus non négligeables, Pascaline vend  des articles de merceries dans son atelier. Pascaline s’approvisionne  dans l’un des marchés du  Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Pascaline sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FIFANA, un troisième crédit. Ce crédit leur servira à augmenter leurs stocks de produits.
texts.en:
The group FIFANA is composed of three persons who live in the same district in Benin. This is the third time that this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé in order to boost their businesses. The group's representative, by the name of Pascaline, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 40 years old and married to a welder by the name of Martial. They have three children, who are all in school and in their care. 

To support herself and her children, Pascaline has been running a business selling beverages for fifteen years. Aside from this business, which generates significant income for her, she sells sewing supplies in her workshop. She is supplied from one of the markets in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and wanting to increase her sales and her revenues, Pascaline and the other members of the group FIFANA are requesting a third loan. This loan will serve to increase their inventory of products.

loans.use: to buy beverages and sewing supplies

loans.name: Christ

texts.en:
Christ, 27, is married to Yandri, 29. She is originally from Java Island. In their marriage, Christ and Yandri have been blessed with two children: Esra, 4 years old; and Dwi, 2 years old. Christ and her children are living with her mother-in-law, as her husband is working in another district. 

In order to help her husband in generating money for their family, Christ runs a kiosk business. Prior to running the business, Christ used to sell mobile phone recharges and cakes. She usually operates her business from 5:00 a.m. until 23:00 p.m. every day. 

Christ desires to improve her business by adding more items to sell, e.g., various snacks and beverages, ice cream, and mobile phone recharges, as demanded by her customers. Christ thinks that the more stuff that she offers, the more customers will like to come to her kiosk. Therefore, Christ is requesting a loan amounting to 4,500,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR) from TLM. She is hoping that TLM will assist her in making her dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy various snacks, beverages, ice cream, and mobile phone recharges to sell

loans.name: Sarlin

texts.en:
Sarlin is a 56-year-old widow and is working as a fishmonger. Her husband passed away six years ago. Sarlin has seven children: Alex, 38; Jenuel, 36; Ansel, 35; Jenny, 33; Max, 31; Yanti, 29; and Yordan, 16, who is studying at the second grade of senior high school. 

Sarlin has been a fishmonger for years. She sells fish in front of her house every day. The income generated from selling fish is spent on her family's needs and the educational needs of her son. Sarlin is dreaming of generating more income to better cover her household needs. She plans to commence a seaweed business, but she needs extra money to do so. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR). She plans to buy seaweed seeds from the seaweed farmer, as well as ropes and floats to cultivate seaweed. She also plans to buy more kinds of fish to sell. Sarlin hopes that TLM will approve her loan application soon.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell, and to buy seaweed seeds, ropes, and floats to cultivate seaweed

loans.name: Babi

texts.fr:
Babi est une femme âgée de 34 ans. Elle est mariée å un revendeur. Elle a 02 enfants.  
Babi travaille comme revendeuse de bijoux, des bazins, des chaussures et des mèches depuis 2003. Elle sert ses clients dans une boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. 
Babi a requis son troisième cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter plus de marchandises.
texts.en:
Babi is a 34-year-old woman who is married to a retailer. She has two children. 

Babi has been working as a retailer of jewelry, damask cloth, footwear, and hair extensions since 2003. She serves her customer in a shop. She purchases her goods in Lomé.

Babi has requested her third loan at the micro-finance institution WAGES in order to buy more merchandise.

loans.use: to buy shoes, hair extensions, and damask cloth

loans.name: Reny

texts.en:
Reny is a 24-year-old single lady who lives with her parent. She is a part-time teacher in an elementary school. The income from being a part-time teacher is not sufficient to fully support her family. Therefore, Reny also operates a kiosk business to generate more income.

Reny is dreaming of improving her kiosk business by adding more stock such as: rice, cooking oil, eggs, tea, milk, sugar, coffee, various beverage, etc. She is requesting a loan of IDR 7,500,000 from TLM. She really hopes that TLM is willing to assist her in improving her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil, eggs, tea, milk, sugar, coffee, various beverages, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 56 years old and has been in mixed farming for 6 years. She produces milk, eggs, and maize, which she sells at the local market. She is married with 8 children, all adults save for the last two, who are still in school.

Anna has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase more birds and expand her poultry business. This is her fourth loan with Juhudi; her prior loans were repaid promptly.

Anna notes that she has had experience with poultry and hopes her new investment will be more productive. She faces significant challenges with dairy since milk is perishable.

loans.use: To purchase birds for her poultry business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks of different goods for general store.

loans.name: Hinsiensien Group

texts.fr: Le groupe HINSIENSIEN est composé de trois personnes qui habitent le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois  que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Simbi est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Simbi est âgée de 29 ans et vit au Bénin. Simbi est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Benjamin. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Simbi a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Simbi mène comme activité depuis dix ans la vente des produits cosmétiques et des mèches. Simbi s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Simbi sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe HINSIENSIEN, un troisième crédit. Les deux premiers crédits reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group HINSIENSIEN is composed of three persons who live in the same district. This is the third time that this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé in order to boost their businesses. The group's representative, by the name of Simbi, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 29 years old and married to a wood worker by the name of Benjamin. They have two children, who are both in school and in their care. 

Simbi did not attend school very much. To support herself and her children, she has been running a business selling cosmetics and hair extensions for ten years. She gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and wanting to increase her sales and her revenues, Simbi and the other members of the group HINSIENSIEN are requesting a third loan. The two previous loans have indeed been repaid.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and hair extensions

loans.name: Aichatou

texts.fr:
Aichatou est une femme  âgée de 32 ans. Elle est mariée å un enseignant. Elle a 02 enfants 
Aichatou travaille comme revendeuse de charbon de bois depuis 2004. Elle vend à ses clients  à domicile et  achète à KANTE. 
Aichatou a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de charbons.
texts.en:
Aichatou is a 32-year-old woman who is married to a teacher. She has two children. 

Aichatou has been working as a retailer of charcoal since 2004. She sells out of her home. She purchases her supplies in KANTE. 

Aichatou has requested her second loan from the micro-finance institution WAGES in order to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue is 40-year-old married man living in Ho Chi Minh City with his son and wife. His wife runs a noodle food stall. 

Hue has a motorcycle washing business, which he has run for six years. He would like to take out a loan to expand his business by purchasing more washing machines and equipment to serve a larger number of customers. 

He hopes that through the loan his business will be able to generate more income and enable him to improve his family's living conditions and put aside savings for his son's education.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle washing machines and equipment to serve more customers.

loans.name: Houenoussou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe HOUENOUSSOU est composé de trois personnes qui habitent le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois  que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Estelle est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Estelle est âgée de 39 ans et vit au Bénin. Estelle est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Séraphin. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Estelle a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Estelle prépare du pâté (fait à base de la farine de blé) qu'elle vend à son domicile et de façon ambulante. A côté de cette activité qui lui génère des revenus l'aidant ainsi à assurer les diverses charges de la maison, Estelle vend du charbon de bois. Estelle mène cette activité depuis cinq ans. Estelle s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Estelle sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe HOUENOUSSOU, un troisième crédit. Les deux premiers crédits reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The group HOUENOUSSOU is composed of three persons who live in the same district. This is the third time that this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé in order to boost their businesses. The group's representative, by the name of Estelle, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 39 years old and married to a wood worker by the name of Séraphin. They have four children, who are all in school and in their care. Estelle did not have much schooling. To support herself and her children, she makes pâté (made from wheat flour) that she sells out of her home and door to door. Aside from this, she sells charcoal, a business which generates the revenues helping her to ensure the various household expenses are covered. She has been in this business for five years. She is supplied from one of the markets in Benin. Seeking to satisfy her customers and wanting to increase her sales and her revenues, Pascaline and the other members of the group HOUENOUSSOU are requesting a third loan. The two previous loans have indeed been repaid.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour and charcoal

loans.name: Anderson

texts.en:
Anderson is a married man with seven children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past eighteen years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in his business. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, maize flour and cooking fat. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, maize flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a farmer in Kitale,Western Kenya. He is 30 years old and married with 3 children aged between 1 and 6. He has been in mixed farming for 5 years with his farm producing milk and eggs which he sells to the local market.

Benard has requested a second loan with Juhudi Kilimo for 41,200 KES. His first loan was promptly paid and he says the first loan improved his family living standard. He hopes the second loan will be better. He wishes to have four dairy cows and a motorcycle for transport business.

He says scarcity of animal feeds and costly management of diseases are the farming challenges.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and expand the dairy unit.

loans.name: Saranchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Saranchimeg is a shoe seller in the bazaar. She is 30 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters, of whom one is a half-year old. She has been running her business since 2000 at an international market called “Narantuul”.  The main process of her business is she purchases shoes from boot-makers wholesale and then sells them retail. 

She has requested a loan to raise her purchasing from boot-makers and increase her business turnover. It is a beneficial to her business and she can sell more.  In a week, she buys only 15-18 pairs of handmade shoes from shoemakers. Now she plans to increase this number.

loans.use: To raise her purchasing from boot-makers and increase her business turnover.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma lives in  Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school.

Fatuma has a business selling soft drinks. She has been in this business for over a few months and she works 7 days out of every week.

Fatuma sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Fatuma has requested for a loan of 900,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of soda and boxes of mineral water. She also generates additional income through selling piped water.

The main business challenges for Fatuma include seasonality and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and also to own many shops selling soft drinks. 

Fatuma lives in a home that she rents, she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses includes food, rent and school fees for her children

loans.use: To  buy more crates of sodas and mineral water.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva lives in  Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.  

Eva has a business selling clothes.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  Eva sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. 

Eva has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy clothes.  She also generates additional income through houses for rent water.

The main business challenges for Eva include seasonality and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and also to start importing clothes from China and to be a wholesaler.

 Eva lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Bahriniso

texts.ru:
Бахринисо разведена и мать 2 детей. Она честная и целеустремленная женщина. Она сама одна кормит своих детей и ей трудно полностью удовлетворять все потребности своих детей, и она всегда нуждаются в поддержку. С этими трудностями она решила заниматься купля продажей материалов, одежды, обуви, продукты питание и сельскохозяйственных культур. Она ежемесячно ездит в других районах за покупки материалов и обуви, а за продовольственными товарами еженедельно. Бахринисо хотела бы получит кредит в размере 2300$ США для покупки материалов и школьных униформ. Она заранее благодарит всех вас за поддержку и милосердие.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Bahriniso is a divorced mother of two children.  She is an honest and goal-oriented woman.  She supports her children on her own and has a hard time satisfying all of the needs of her children, and always needs support.  She decided to deal with these difficulties by getting involved in buying and selling materials, shoes, food products and agricultural crops.  She travels monthly to other districts to purchase materials and shoes, and travels weekly to buy food products.  Bahriniso wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2300 for the purchase of materials and school uniforms.  She thanks everyone in advance for the support and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase materials and school uniforms

loans.name: Abduhafiz

texts.ru: Абдухафиз проживает в городе Исфара. Ему 55 лет. Он женат, детей не имеет. Абдухафиз занимается торговлей на рынке. У него имеется торговая точка, где он продает фрукты и овощи. Этим видом деятельности занимается сем лет. Кредит берет для покупки яблок, винограда, груши и персиков.
texts.en: Abduhafiz lives in the city of Isfara.  He is 55 years old, married and has no children.  Abduhafiz is involved in retail sales at the market.  He has a retail outlet, where he sells fruits and vegetables.  He has been involved in this business for seven years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of apples, grapes, pears and peaches.

loans.use: to purchase apples, grapes, pears and peaches

loans.name: Batdorj

texts.en:
Mr.Batdorj, 36 and a driver, lives with his three daughters and his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His daughters study in secondary school and his wife manages a basic commodities store beside their house. 

Batdorj has been working as a cargo driver privately since 2004. He has requested a loan to raise his store's circulating assets through purchasing more commodities from the market, especially facilities for study.  Because a new session of the academic year is starting, he thinks there will be a lot of sales at his store and the income is going to increase absolutely. 

By the way, his family is one of the very busy and happiest families of the world.

loans.use: To raise his store's circulating assets through purchasing more commodities from the market, especially facilities for study.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase caustic and oil for her soap business.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Uganda.  She is married and has five children, two of whom are in school.  Betty has a food stall. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  

Betty sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Betty has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bunches of bananas, cassava and sweet potatoes. The main business challenges for Betty include seasonality, thieves and defaulters.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and also to start going to villages for foodstuffs. Betty lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs  like bunches of bananas, cassava and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 46 years old and lives in the village of Gundaway Cabarroguis, Quirino. She is married with three children. She is business-minded woman because she has been engaged in two businesses,  fish selling and running a grocery store.

Rita has a retail shop that sells a variety of fresh fish. She has had this business for two years while she has had her grocery store for four years. According to her, she is able to earn P5,000 monthly with her fish selling and P3,000 from her grocery store.  She is requesting a loan amount of P50,000 to buy different kinds of fish such as tilapia, milk fish and mackerel to sell in the market.

She hopes that she can increase her profit so that she can give her children a good quality education.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of fish such as milk fish, mackerel, and tilapia for fish-selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more stones to break up and chicken mash.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plastic dishes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a father of 4 children aged between 8 and 3 years, with first two already schooling. He has been in mixed farming for four years, producing and selling milk and maize to the local market.

Godfrey has made a first loan request with Juhudi Kilimo for 41,200 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the milk produced will help supplement the family meals as well as provide income for other needs. He remains optimistic with dairy due to past experience and hopes to own five dairy cows in five years.Godfrey says dairy diseases are a great threat to farming business. 

He is looking forward to repaying the loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cloth and kitchen utensils (nested bowls, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice and flour to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en: Maribeth is 47, married and has one school-age child. In order to support her family, she makes a living by running a motorcycle transportation service in her village. She has been in this line of work for almost four years and earns about PHP 6,000 a month in profits. Because of the high cost of living, she needs to increase her income. She plans to do this by securing a loan for PHP 20,000 to buy gasoline and spare parts for her motorcycle. She will also use some of the money to pay for her children's school fees and meet other expenses. Her goal is to continue to expand her business through patience and hard work.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her transportation service.

location.town: Brgy. Sto. Domingo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, oil and spices for her business

loans.name: Baasansuren

texts.en:
Baasansuren is 37 years old and a specialist of auto monitoring. She is a divorced woman and now lives with her two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her older daughter Ganzaya is a college student, and her younger daughter is 5 years old and likes music very much.

Baasansuren has requested a loan equivalent to $1,200 USD. It will be dedicated as an additional funding to start a new beauty salon business. It takes a lot of equipment and products to start a beauty service. Currently she is almost prepared to open her salon, which is very clean and comfortable with modern scenery. 

She plans to hire some beauticians for her business. She has a little bit of a financial issue and currently she can’t purchase some necessary equipment and other commodities. She will use her loan to buy the equipment she needs to open a beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy the equipment she needs to open a beauty salon.

loans.name: Anzhik

texts.en:
Anjik was born in 1950 in Berdavan Village, in the area of Ijevan, Armenia. She now lives in Ijevan city with her two sons, daughter-in-law, and grandchild. 

Anjik's daughter is married and lives separately. Anjik's husband works in the Russian Federation and shares his family's expenses.

Anjik is an accountant, and after graduating from the University, she worked in different companies. Anzhik says that salaries of accountants is not high in her region, so she decided to run her own business. 

Since 2006, Anjik has engaged in the clothes trading business in Ijevan’s clothes market. She rents a trading stall in a market and sells women's clothes and shoes that she buys from Yerevan and from neighboring countries. 

Anjik’s son and daughter-in-law help with her trading business so she has enough time to run acounting and bookkeeping for small companies.

Anjik asks from KIVA lenders 750,000 Armenia Drams (AMD) loan to buy an assortment of new clothes for her business.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of new clothes for her business.

loans.name: Twisungane Tudahemukirana Group

texts.fr:
Marceline  est agricultrice de pomme de terre et elle est membre du groupe Twisungane Tudahemukirana. Elle est née au Rwanda et a 27 ans. Elle est mariée et elle a 3 enfants de 3 à 7 ans, dont 2 enfants  scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire. 
C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit pour acheter des grains des tomates, des pompes, des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre. 
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’augmentation des quantités pour agriculture en augmentant l’étendue des champs. Dans les prochaines années Marceline voudrait être une grande agricultrice des tomates  dans sa région et être le fournisseur des usines. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants et aide sa famille d’en sortir dans la pauvrette.
texts.en:
Marceline is a potato farmer and a member of the group Twisungane Tudahemukirana. She was born in Rwanda and is 27 years old. She is married and has three children, who are 3 to 7 years old. Two of the children are in school. She has a 6th grade education. 

This loan cycle is her second one with ACB. She is going to use her loan to buy tomato seeds, pumps, and fertilizers and to cover the cost of labor. 

Her strategy for business growth is to increase her yields by increasing the reach of her fields. In the next few years, Marceline would like to be a major tomato farmer in her region and to be the supplier for factories. With the profits, she foresees covering her children's schooling costs and helping her family climb out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy tomato seeds, pumps, and fertilizers and to pay for labor

loans.name: La Main De Dieu Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LA MAIN DE DIEU est composé de trois personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier au Bénin. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Anne-Marie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Anne-Marie est âgée de 33 ans et est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Julien. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Anne-Marie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Anne-Marie mène comme activité depuis une dizaine d'année, la vente de chaussures et de sacs par le système de distribution. Anne-Marie s’approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Anne-Marie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe LA MAIN DE DIEU, un deuxième crédit. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
LA MAIN DE DIEU [The Hand of God] group is composed of three people who live in the same district in Bénin. This is the second time that the group seeks the financial support of ALIDÉ in order to raise the level of their businesses. 

The representative of the group, named Anne-Marie, is the one with the raised hand in the photo. Anne-Marie is 33 years old and is married to a mechanic named Julien. The couple has four children, all in school and still their dependents. Anne-Marie lives together with her husband and their children. The diverse household expenses are paid for by the couple. To achieve this, Anne-Marie has carried on her business for 10 years, the sale of shoes and bags by the distribution system. Anne-Marie stocks up in one of the markets of Bénin. In the quest of the satisfaction of her customers and to increase the amount of business and income, Anne-Marie seeks, together with the other members of LA MAIN DE DIEU group, a second loan. The previously received loan was repaid well.

loans.use: To buy shoes and bags.

loans.name: Murodkul

texts.ru:
Муродкул женат и отец 2 детей. Он целеустремленный и честный человек. Муродкул любит свою семью и всегда старается обеспечить их всеми необходимыми вещами. Он занимается купля продажей материалы, детские и женские одежды, а также арбузы, морковь и лука. Муродкул хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свой прибыль с целью улучшение жилищное условие. Он хотел бы получит займ в размере 1100$ США для покупки школьных униформ. Он заранее благодарит вас всех за вашу помощь и доброты. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Murodkul is married and a father of two children.  He is a goal-oriented and honest person.  Murodkul loves his family and always tries to provide them with all the necessary things.  He is involved in buying and selling of materials, children's and women's clothing and also watermelons, carrots and onions.  Murodkul wants to expand his business ad maximize his profits in order to improve his living conditions.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1100 for the purchase of school uniforms.  He thanks all of you in advance for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase school uniforms

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Jocelyne

texts.en:
Jocelyne is a hard-working mother who is engaged in selling AVON, Natasha and MSE products in her village. She is 48 years old and married with two school-aged children. She aims to strengthen her business so that she can earn income to help her husband finance the education of their children and renovate their house to live more comfortably.

She wants to increase her product offerings to satisfy her custumers' needs, but due to inadequate capital, she needs an additional capital of 25,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy lotions, body sprays, underwear, jewelry, footwear, and shirts to sell in the village. She believes that her patience and strong determination will help her to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy lotion, body sprays, underwear, jewelry, footwear, and shirts to sell in the village.

loans.name: Zebo

texts.ru: Зебо жительница города Исфары. Ей 43 года. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Зебо более 8 лет занимается торговлей. Она имеет торговую точку на рынке, где продает орехи, миндаль и изюм. Кредит берет для покупки сухофруктов, чтобы увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Zebo lives in the city of Isfara.  She is 43 years old, married and has four children.  Zebo has been involved in retail sales for over eight years.  She has a retail outlet, where she sells nuts, almonds and raisins.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of dried fruits in order to increase the assortment of her products.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits

loans.name: Jesugnon Tokan Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUGNON TOKAN est composé de trois personnes qui  habitent le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois  que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Honoré Rufine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Honoré Rufine est âgée de 45 ans et est mariée à Dieu-Donné, un gérant. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Honoré Rufine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Honoré Rufine mène comme activité depuis vingt ans la vente de sachets, de façon ambulante. Honoré Rufine s’approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Honoré Rufine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUGNON TOKAN, un deuxième crédit. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group JESUGNON TOKAN is composed of three persons who live in the same district. This is the second time that this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé in order to boost their businesses. The group's representative, by the name of Honoré Rufine, in the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 45 years old and married to Dieu-Donné, who is a manager. They have four children, who are all in school and in their care. Honoré Rufine lives together with her husband and children. The various household expenses are covered by the couple. To do so, she has been running a business selling pouches (often small plastic bags) door to door for twenty years. She gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and wanting to increase her sales and her revenues, Honoré Rufine and the other members of the group JESUGNON TOKAN are requesting a second loan. The loan previously received has been repaid.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
For the last five years, Rachael has been rearing pigs for commercial purposes in Kanyariri in Kikuyu town. She is 34 years old and married to her husband, Edward. They have two school-aged children. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD  by a KADET staff member, and she is applying for her second loan after repaying back a previous loan well and in good time. She intends to use the loan amount to buy chicks for rearing alongside pigs for commercial purposes.

In the future, Rachael aspires to expand her business and raise enough income to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy chicks for rearing alongside pigs for commercial purposes.

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en:
Meshack is a resident and a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya, is aged 24, and is still single. He has been in farming for 3 years and currently employs three farmhands who help in producing sugar cane, vegetables and onions which are sold to the local market.

Meshack has made a loan request with Juhudi Kilimo for 60,000 KES, this being his second loan request after successful repayment of the first one. He says this will help him purchase a motorcycle for a transport business. He remains optimistic he will manage to benefit from the current boom in the transport industry and expand his farming business to dairy too.

Meshack says the outbreak of diseases during rainy seasons remain a challenge to farmers. He adds that Juhudi loans really cater for small holder farmers needs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Nuraddin

texts.en:
Nuraddin is a 55-year-old man, is married, and has one daughter. All of the family members are involved in a family agricultural business that is their only source of the income. 

Nuraddin earns a living by breeding cattle and now has four cows. He sells his products at the local open market. He requests a loan in amount of 1,000 Azerbaijan New Manats (AZN) to buy three more cows to increase his income. Support from this loan will help Nuraddin to economically provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy three more cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy calling cards and other telephone accessories.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 23-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and five siblings. He has eight years of experience working in air conditioning and ventilation. And in 2009, he decided to start working on his own.  His business is doing well, especially after realizing that the demand in the region for such service is increasing. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new tools needed to satisfy all his customers' demands. This type of business is very profitable in Lebanon and this man needs so much support to succeed and get the opportunity to open his own shop.

loans.use: to purchase new tools

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu is 27 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married and her husband is employed by a construction company. They have two children ages six and eight years old, both of whom live with their parents and are presently in school.

For the past six years Fatu has been selling rice and vegetables among other things in the local market. She is requesting a loan of 17,000 LRD from BRAC to purchase more goods to sell.

She hopes to buy land and build a house on it.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
"You will never succeed unless you try your best," says Danilo, a responsible father who has four adult-age children. He has owned and managed a 1.5 hectare rice field for almost 38 years, earning a profit of 30,000 PHP per crop. As the fruit of his patience and hard work, all of his children have already graduated, and they are now employed.

Now he is always busy, for he has been chosen as the captain of his barangay. Despite this, Danilo wants to continue managing his rice field to earn money and save for his future. Therefore, he wants to ask for a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and pesticides and for labor to sustain his rice production. He is hoping that he will increase his production and income to be used for food and clothing and to save for future emergencies.

Danilo believes that he will be successful in carrying out all his plans, for he has strong faith and determination.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and for labor to sustain his rice production.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 49 years old and supports five members of her family. Her children are 25, 23, eighteen, fifteen and eight years old.

Leah sells new clothes in the Kabisaga trading center in Kapsabet and has been in the business for twelve years, earning a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

Leah has been given 40,000 KES from KADET LTD as her third loan after repaying the previous two successfully. She hopes to use this money to add more new clothes to her business. The profits will be used to meet the daily basic needs of her family.

Her dream is to own a wholesale shop in the town.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Talahatou

texts.fr:
Talahatou est une femme âgée de 40 ans. Elle est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants.
 Talahatou travaille comme revendeuse de savons et pagnes depuis 2000. Elle vend à toutes personnes dans un quartier de la place après achat au Ghana et au Grand Marché de Lomé. 
Talahatou a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des savons et des pagnes.
texts.en: Talahatou is a 40-year old woman. She is single, without children. Since 2000, she has been selling soap and “pagnes,” traditional colorful fabrics. She sells to general public in a local district after stocking up in Ghana and at the  Big Market of Lomé. Talahatou has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy soap and “pagnes.”

loans.use: to buy traditional "pagnes" fabrics and soap

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is from the village of Tsinandali in the Kakheti region. She is 37 years old, married and lives with her husband, Ivane.

Natalia works in the Alexander Chavchavadze museum located in her village (Chavchavadze was a famous Georgian poet). Ivane works in a local winery. In addition to this work, Natalia and Ivane have a vineyard of two hectares as well as a one-hectare maize field. The family sells grapes and maize when they are in season. Their total monthly income is 750 GEL.

750 GEL does not result in enough to save up and beyond their present income. Therefore, Natalia has requested a loan of 1,100 GEL to purchase materials and hire laborers to renovate her house. The house was repaired a long time ago, and it is too uncomfortable now for the family.

After renovation, the living conditions of the family will improve.

loans.use: to purchase materials and hire laborers to renovate her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy unfinished soapstone to make sculptures.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renew his business tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase 6 cartoons of sardine fish for her business

loans.name: Issaba

texts.fr:
Issaba est un homme âgé de 42ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a 04 enfants. 
Issaba travaille comme revendeur d ‘huile à moteur depuis 2009. Il vend dans un quartier de la place à ses clients. Il achète les produits au marché. 
Issaba a requis son troisième cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter plus de marchandises.
texts.en:
Issaba is 42 years old. He is married to a retailer and the father of four children. He has been selling motor oil since 2009. His store is located in a neighborhood of his town. He gets his supplies at the market.

Issaba came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for his third loan to buy more merchandise.

loans.use: to buy cans of motor oil.

loans.name: Anjelina

texts.en:
Anjelina is aged 40 years, and has been in mixed farming for five years in her rural home town of Kitale, Western Kenya. She is married with one child aged 15 and currently employs one farmhand. Her produce of maize and milk are sold locally.

Anjelina has made a loan request of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her construct a bigger poultry unit for her birds. She says the house will protect her birds and yield better income that will uplift her family. She remains optimistic she will earn enough income and add more cows to her dairy unit.

Anjelina says finding feeds during dry seasons is a challenge.

loans.use: To construct a bigger poultry unit

loans.name: Kawsar

texts.en: Kawsar is a 54-year-old married woman living with her husband and two children. She is from Lebanon. After 17 years of experience in grocery shops, she opened a small mini-market in 2007. She has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and sells products that meet local demands. She helps her husband with the household expenses. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her store’s inventory. She hopes that her income will increase as a result of the loan.

loans.use: to increase her store’s inventory

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irene is a lady aged 41 years old who supports six members of her family. Her children are eighteen, sixteen, thirteen, seven and four years old.

Irene sells secondhand clothes in the Kamoywo trading center in Kapsabet. She has been in business for five years, earning a monthly income of 8,000 KES.

Irene is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES from KADET LTD. This will be her fourth loan, and she intends to use it to purchase three bales of secondhand clothes to sell. She plans to use the anticipated profits to provide for her family’s basic needs.

Irene hopes to be self-sufficient in the future.

loans.use: to purchase three bales of secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kumri

texts.ru:
Кумри умная и добрая женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать 6 детей. У них очень большая семья и им нужна дополнительный доход. По этой причине она начала заниматься купля продажей тканей и продовольственные товары. Она очень старается улучшить свою семейную жизнь и обучить своих детей на престижных школах и  университетах. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000$ США для покупки школьных униформ и канцтовары, потому что скоро начинается время учебы и все приготовится в школах. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Kumri is a smart and kind woman.  She is a married and loving mother of six children.  Because she has a very large family, she needs additional income.  This is why, she started to buy and sell fabrics and food products.  She tries hard to improve her family life and ensure that her children attend prestigious schools and universities.  She is requesting a loan in the sum of $2000 for the purchase of school uniforms and supplies because school year is about to start, and everyone is getting ready for school.

loans.use: to purchase school uniforms and supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 20-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and three siblings. Despite his young age, he has built a good experience working in floor covering. With his requested loan of $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will increase his business capital and invest in purchasing new tools he needs. In that way, he will be able to serve more customers and therefore enlarge his business operation. In the future, he is hoping to be able to save enough money so that he can open his own business.

loans.use: to increase his business capital and purchase new tools

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
Raymond has been selling shoes for the last four years in Kayole in Nairobi City. He is 35 years old married to Mercy. They have been blessed with one child.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be his first loan, which he intends to use to construct shelves and add to his stock of shoes.

In the future, Raymond hopes to open a wholesale shop for selling shoes.

loans.use: to construct shelves and buy more shoes.

loans.name: Béatrice Ama

texts.fr:
Béatrice Ama est une femme  âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle a 03enfants.
Béatrice Ama travaille comme revendeuse de bananes, de farine, de charbon, de tapioca  depuis 1989. Elle livre ses marchandises à la maison après achat à Danyi(KPALIME).
Béatrice Ama a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de charbon, des bananes, de la farine.
WAMPA
texts.en:
Béatrice Ama is 47 years old. She is married to a driver and the mother of three children. She has been selling bananas, flour, coal and tapioca since 1989. She sells her goods out of her home after having bought them in Danyi (Kpalimé).

Béatrice Ama came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for her first loan to buy coal, bananas and flour.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coal.

loans.name: Manoelalo

texts.fr:
Manoelalo est une femme âgée de 49 ans. Elle est mariée å un militaire. Elle a 04enfants.
Manoelalo travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale et des mèches depuis 1998. Elle vend dans une boutique à la maison. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. 
Manoelalo a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des marchandises.
texts.en: Manoelalo is a 49-year old woman. She is married to a soldier and has 4 children. She has been selling groceries and hair extensions from her home-based store since 1998. She gets her supplies in Lomé. Manoelalo is requesting a second loan from WAGES so that she can buy more groceries for resale.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for resale.

loans.name: Abir

texts.en: Abir is a 37-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and three school-aged children. She has owned an internet shop since 2006 where she welcomes customers who ask for internet access such as Messenger, Google, internet games etc. She cooperates with her husband to satisfy the family needs. In order to expand her business, Abir is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new computers. In the future, she is planning to distribute internet connection all over her town.

loans.use: to purchase new computers

loans.name: Hodalo

texts.fr:
Hodalo est une femme âgée de 31ans. Elle est mariée å un caissier. Elle a 02 enfants.
Hodalo travaille comme revendeuse des produits d’alimentation générale et des articles scolaires depuis 2007. Elle vend à la maison à ses clients. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. 
Hodalo a requis son troisième cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de riz, des cartons de tomates, spaghetti, des bidons d’huile et autres.
texts.en: Hodalo is a 31-year old woman. She is married to a cashier and has 2 children. She has been selling groceries and school supplies from her home-based store since 2007. She gets her supplies in Lomé. Hodalo is asking for a third loan from WAGES so that she can restock her store with groceries including bags of rice, boxes of tomatoes, spaghetti and cans of oil.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, boxes of tomatoes, cans of oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase dairy feed
